story:
About US:

Chicago Dyke March Collective is a grassroots mobilization and celebration of dyke, queer, bisexual, and transgender resilience. It is an anti-racist, anti-violent, volunteer-led, grassroots effort with a goal to bridge together communities across race, ethnicity, socioeconomic status, age, size, gender identity, gender expression, sexuality, culture, immigrant status, spirituality, and ability.

 

Where you come in:

Chicago Dyke March is an event that celebrates queers, dykes, and trans and dykes all across the spectrum. The Chicago Dyke March mobilizes all of us who live, love, struggle for justice, and express ourselves in ways that aren’t necessarily recognized or supported by mainstream society. Every year, we work hard to assure that not only the march is a success, but that we continue to build on the successes (and mistakes) of those before us to make the event even more successful, community led, and offers a place of celebration and visibility for all that attend.

 

As a march and as a movement, CDM brings folks together, and builds relationships - across movements, communities, neighborhoods, identities, gender presentations, abilities, and immigration statuses. For us, it’s about doing community, and movement-building work within and among queer communities all within the capacity of a completely volunteer led collective.

We’re intentional about fundraising and reach out to organizations we consider as anti-oppressive and aligning with our principles and values.

 

On June 29, 2013- Chicago Dyke March will take place in the neighborhood of Argyle with an ending rally in Margate Park. In preparation for this fabulous and fierce event we are trying our hardest to raise enough money to pay for permits -- which have gone up every year and have become more difficult to navigate --  a stage, vendors, and other city costs. 

Every year we hear about how Chicago Dyke March changes so many lives, how this is the only time all year they feel like they are part of a supportive community, and gives them strength that lasts the entire year. Can you help us make sure it happens this year?

$4000 is the bare minimum of what we need for this year and to start planning for next year. If we all pull together we can raise more to make sure all Dyke March costs are covered as well as pay our amazing performers/DJ's at our other fundraising events and day of the march. 

Our community is BIG - Chicago Dyke March touches thousands of people! If everyone can contribute a small amount, we can continue to make sure that this celebration of our community’s resilience keeps happening. 

We also take in kind donations, raffle prizes, and have a list items that also are key to making the march a success, for more information about this email us at dykemarchchicago@gmail.com.

We fundraise year round. If you would like to donate outside of this campaign to ease cost taken from indie gogo, they can be made using our Pay Pal Account. Simply press the button below.

story:
THE HEART OF THE MATTER: 

• Found a perfect space for a studio/gallery for myself and to share with the community: "ART SPACE malibu."

• I am having a "sale" (see "perks") through Indiegogo to help get it up and running.

• ART SPACE malibu will hold art sessions for local artists, and host evening events for the Malibu community, introducing art, music and more.

 

THE DETAILS:     

I have been dreaming of a space like this since I was a kid!  Recently my dream was reinvisioned when my kids both started school full time and I decided to move forward with my art.   I have decided to use this awesome Indiegogo platform to have a "sale" and donate 100% of proceeds to this exciting endeavor.

MY GOAL: 

ART SPACE malibu will be more than a studio for me but an art space for the community, bursting with adult art sessions, community events that introduce new artists to the Malibu community and any other events that may evolve from ART SPACE malibu. My personal goal is to paint at least 10 paintings to create 2  "collections" within this first year and come up with a few more jewelry designs...you can own some of my work just by supporting.  Jewelry, prints, paintings and judaica  are available - check it all out!!

      My financial goal is to raise enough money for ART SPACE malibu to get a running start and generate funds to cover the first few events and basic supplies.  I set my goal low, knowing I have to cover the rent first and foremost - all money raised above $7500 will go towards supplies and maintaining the studio (i.e. office supplies, model fees, drawing horses, art supplies, and events costs).  I believe that with the support of my friends, family, clients, new supporters and the community, this can be a lasting staple in Malibu.  I hope the community will look forward to monthly events and locals artists can come sketch and draw with me.  Professional instruction will also be made available when the demand rises.  I set my goal low at $7,500 but hope to raise up to $20,000 as that will be the true operating costs for the first year.  I know that it will all work out one way or another and thank everyone for any and all support : )

       So...See what is for "sale" and think about what you may like for friends, family, upcoming gifts or for yourself, know that every penny will be going to ART SPACE malibu and to help a dream come true!


Everyone who participates will be listed on front page of www.ARTSPACEmalibu.com

SPREAD THE WORD!!!

So excited to share this with all of you. Thank you again.

: )

story:
It's that time of year again! . . . 

We're happy to announce the 2012 Southern Indiana Center for the Arts Minutes to Memories Garden donation drive...

Last year’s drive was another great success with a John Mellencamp autographed guitar being won by Dan Harper of North Vernon IN. 

Larry McDonald of Seymour who is the owner of This Old Guitar store located in downtown Seymour has graciously donated another acoustic guitar for the Minutes to Memories donation drive 2012.  

Through 2011 the Minutes To Memories gardens were enjoyed and admired by Seymour locals visiting the Art Center as well as the many out of town visitors that come SICA's way. 

SICA in Seymour Indiana has the only permanent exhibit of John's paintings in the country. The property is owned by John and leased to SICA for an Art gallery and community art activities. More information on SICA can be found on SICA's website, their blog, or visit them on facebook. 

The Minutes to Memories Gardens fills the space between the Art Center, the Printing museum and the "Wild Nights" pottery barn. The Minutes to Memories Gardens were conceived by the Mellenheads to honor John's Grandmother Laura which have been funded by the Mellenheads and the Seymour locals.



We will be giving away the autographed guitar as part of the donation drive at Bustock Aug 4th, 2012, hosted by SICA and WJAA.

Don Hill will be drawing the ticket of the lucky winner from the names of those participating in our donation drive.

ALL MONIES RAISED DURING THIS DRIVE GO DIRECTLY TO THE MAINTENANCE OF THE MINUTES TO MEMORIES GARDENS ON THE GROUNDS AT SICA. 

Donations can be made in increments of $5.  

Each $5 donation gives you one ticket w/ special breaks along the way

$5 = 1 ticket; $20 = 5 tickets; $50 = 15 tickets; $100 = 30 tickets, etc.  

The more you give, the better your chances of winning!

Several ways to donate:

  • CREDIT CARD: Donate by credit card here on the site.  All donations will be registered for the contest April 4th.
  • BY MAIL: Check/money order {please add $1 for US orders, $5 for international orders} payable to SICA mailed to: Doug Anderson 8091 Bay Brook Dr. Indianapolis, IN 46256. Please include: name, address & email along with a self-address-stamped envelope. Your tickets will be sent to you via the postal mail
  • IN PERSON: at SICA Friday Night Live concerts through the summer, at the SICA gift show or at the This Old Guitar Store in Seymour, Indiana.


Feel free to contact Doug Anderson doug.anderson@roche.com if needed for additional information. 

MINUTES TO MEMORIES 2012

story:
In the neglected Northeast San Fernando Valley, many can only see chaos.

However, in this area of Los Angeles, home to many with little material means, there is an abundance of innate imagination and talent. Art. Song. Music. Poetry. Dance. Stories. Ideas.

The arts have consistently proven to be the most effective means to lift the most desolate areas, bring together fractured communities, and transform lives, especially those in the grips of violence.

Knowing that the first move from chaos isn't order, but creativity, Tia Chucha's Centro Cultural has, since 2001, served as the cultural cornerstone of the Northeast San Fernando Valley, offering a diverse array of free and low-cost arts and cultural workshops and events. We are also the only full-service bookstore in the area, offering an eclectic selection of mind-nourishing books, including poetry from our own nationally-recognized Tia Chucha Press.


When we provide places for people to imagine, to express, to share, and to create, we uplift the spirit needed to also help remove the real constraints of current economic and social realities. We have survived and succeeded because we have always responded to obstacles by becoming more imaginative and encompassing. We have refused to give up on the arts. We have refused to give up on artists and, as we are all artists, we have refused to give up on our community.


In celebration of our first decade of building community through arts and culture in the Northeast Valley, we're creating a documentary film and book, to be released in 2012, called "Art Transforms Communities" in collaboration with Denise Sandoval, Chican@ Studies Professor at California State University Northridge, and filmmaker John Cantú. The project will feature interviews and essays from Northeast Valley artists who have intersected with Tia Chucha's over the years.


The Los Angeles County Arts Commission has generously provided a matching grant of $10,000 for this project, but we won't receive the funding unless we raise the first $10,000. We need YOUR help to ensure this vitally important project will see the light of day.


Please consider making a tax-deductible contribution to this project today!  Also, please help us to spread the word. Strength in numbers!  With your support, we can do this!


In Solidarity,


Luis & Trini Rodriguez, Co-Founders, Tia Chucha's Centro Cultural

& Tia Chucha's Board & Staff

story:
Be a Piece of History

Create and support public art -- and celebrate Nashville’s culture and creativity -- by donating to the construction of “Migration,” a striking 30- by 12-foot mosaic mural that surely will become the city’s newest landmark.

Your gift of just $10 (more if you can!) buys you “ownership” of one of the 7,000 colorful pieces of tile used in the construction of this one-of-a-kind work of public art, which is being put together piece-by-piece by artist Jairo Prado and Middle Tennessee volunteers of all ages.

Once completed, “Migration” will be the façade of the Casa Azafrán Community Center, a 29,000-square-foot center at 2195 Nolensville Pike and future home to six nonprofit agencies that offer services in areas of health, education, legal, business and the arts.

Your donation means you, too, have helped create something uniquely Nashville, built by Nashville and representative of the mosaic of people who call Nashville home. (Imagine, it’s like buying a piece of the iconic Batman Building.)

What is Casa Azafrán?

Created by Conexión Américas, a nationally recognized nonprofit that serves Latino Families in Middle Tennessee, Casa Azafrán is a nonprofit collaborative that will be home to programs by several well-known agencies:

  • United Neighborhood Health Services
  • Family and Children’s Service
  • YWCA of Nashville and Middle Tennessee
  • Justice for Our Neighbors of Tennessee
  • The Global Education Center

The center for all Nashvillians will be a place to gather for things such as English classes, ethnic cooking lessons, entrepreneurship education, health services, after-school programs, art exhibits, dance lessons, events and more.

It is located just 3 short miles from downtown Nashville, between the Fairgrounds and I-440, at the gateway to Nashville's International District.

To learn more, read this great story in the Nashville Scene.

We Need Your Support

Your generous contributions will pay for “Migration’s” materials for completion, artist fee and labor-intensive installation.

Migration’s projected $40,000 cost is being funded by the National Endowment for the Arts, the Tennessee Arts Commission and by people like you!

We have raised $15,000 for the mosaic, so we need another $25,000.

Casa Azafrán, overall, is a $5 million project funded by public grants and donations from corporations and individuals. So far, we have raised $2.5 million, which means we are half-way there. 

Your gift, of any size, makes a huge difference in creating a community that will empower so many local families and children to work toward achieving their own American Dream.

 Other Ways You Can Help

Sign up to work on “Migration” at the beautiful Prado studio. It’s fun and easy.  

Sign up at our website for news and events at Casa Azafrán and Conexión Américas. 

Follow us on Twitter and Facebook. 

Share this page with your friends and family and use the easy share tools available via Indiegogo.

Gracias!

See you soon!

Join us Dec. 1 at the Casa Azafrán Community Center Grand Opening celebration. And, we know we’ll see you outside the center, too, snapping shots of “Migration” for many years to come. Be sure to come inside, OK?

*** Please contact us at info@conamericas.com for a donation receipt once you have given.

story:
*This book will be made by self-publishing.

Self-publishing is the publication of any book or other media by the author of the work, without the involvement of an established third-party publisher. A self-published physical book is said to be privately printed. The author is responsible and in control of entire process including design (cover/interior), formats, price, distribution, marketing & PR. The authors can do it all themselves or outsource all or part of the process to companies that offer these services.(by wikipedia)

story:
At the end of February, Matthew John Lehr (aka Jawn Johnson), Lauren Wolf, and Barkleigh the Dog will embark on a cross country tour that has the potential to impact many individuals but we need your help.

What began as an opportunity for Matthew to promote the start of his clothing brand, Cellardoor, has morphed into something much greater. Spending most of his life in management Matthew has long had the dream of inspiring people in a different way; as an artist whose work inspires people to be open minded and live passionately. Lauren has always strived to help the people around her, this drive and determination has led to a successful career as a community based therapeutic counselor. These two lives and ideals have merged into this tour and a creative, inspiring way to not only bring Cellardoor to the masses but to serve as an avenue to volunteer time and effort in communities across the country but we need your help too.


For anyone looking to support Cellardoor, the art, the concept, the belief in helping others, you have the opportunity to start contributing to these causes starting today.


What is Cellardoor?

Cellardoor came to fruition as a way to brand Jawn Johnson's artwork, inspiration, and style into a medium that is accessible to practically everyone.


While I may not be a classically trained artist what I lack in experience is made up for in the love, passion, and emotion that goes into creating a new piece. I want to share that feeling of hope and wonderment - where anything is possible - with as many people as possible. By printing my designs on apparel and traveling the country to promote, I have created the opportunity to connect with a great amount of people. When people wear a Cellardoor design I want them to feel confident about their passions, to take some time and find the beauty in today, and to encourage others to shine in the same way.




Matthew’s Experience.

I have spent almost 18 years in the retail industry, the last 5 years as a store manager at a $1.5 million dollar surf and skate shop. During my time there, my teams were always ranked top in the district, region, and company. Spending so many years in this industry I have seen how brands have grown and what have been the leading ideas into getting them produced and sold on a national level. With that said my favorite part of being a manager has always been helping people and teaching my staff how to have fun and be successful at the same time. I must say the relationships I have built through my career are priceless and have developed into friendships I will value my entire life.
These two lives and ideals have merged into this tour and a creative, inspiring way to not only bring Cellardoor to the masses but to serve as an avenue to volunteer time and effort in communities across the country but we need your help too.



Lauren’s Experience.

I have spent most of my life helping others and have made careers out of my desire to make a difference. My roles have varied - coach, teacher, counselor, director - but my main focus has always been to help improve the lives of others. The majority of my experience has been in the mental health field which has taught me so much about the importance of health and wellness of the human spirit. There are many different factors and ideas that could improve the world we live in but ultimately I think we all need to do a better job of looking out for each other. Matthew and I both agree that understanding and empathy are two traits that are quickly disappearing around us. I have been fortunate enough in my life thus far and it just feels right to give back - in as many different ways as possible.


The Tour.

Our daily lives will consist of traveling, participating in local art and craft events, a grass roots promotion of Cellardoor and volunteering our time and energy to the greater good. We have just recently hooked up with Volunteer Match and Random Acts of Kindness to help us participate in volunteering events all across the country. Even with their help we are always looking to add new events and hear about the causes our fans are most passionate about. The better job we do at promoting and continuing to create opportunities for Cellardoor the greater our impact will be on communities and passionate individuals all across the country. 


Contribution breakdown.

  • 0-$5000 ---  The closer we get to $5000 will allow for the successful launch of a Cellardoor webstore. We will be able to purchase merchandise in bulk orders including many different options for men and women. Additional costs will include the printing of designs on the merchandise. 

  • $5000-$10000 --- This will allow Cellardoor to target printers who can handle the capabilities of printing original paintings as Cellardoor designs. Cellardoor will also be able to expand merchandise past T-shirts and hoodies into hats, beanies and other accessories. .

  • $10000-$20000 --- The end goal will allow Cellardoor to purchase its own printer that will properly transfer elaborate original designs onto merchandise for our growing fan base. 


Keep in mind when the Cellardoor webstore is up and running we will be able to dedicate a portion of the proceeds to an organization or organizations we will have met and worked with while on tour.



How can you support Cellardoor and get something back?

For anyone looking to support Cellardoor, the art, the concept, the belief in helping others, you have the opportunity to start contributing to these causes starting today. To help out Cellardoor and the tour share this page, email it to a friend, Tweet about it. The internet is a powerful tool and by sharing your support on social media you will further help our cause and market the Cellardoor brand. In addition please support Cellardoor by choosing one or more of the perks including Cellardoor logo tees and hoodies. You may also choose to purchase an original painting, each with their own unique description, which are also available as 8x10 signed and numbered prints.


T-shirt designs 








Please visit the gallery tab above to view all available original paintings that are also available as signed, numbered, and framed 8 x 10 prints.


Thank you to everyone for their support.


For the first time ever you can shop us online at

www.CellardoorClothing.com


And for all original artwork and prints from paintings to beautiful landscapes from our cross country tour, check out

www.Etsy.com/shop/SurrealDreamscapes
story_txt:
At the end of February, Matthew John Lehr (aka Jawn Johnson), Lauren Wolf, and Barkleigh the Dog will embark on a cross country tour that has the potential to impact many individuals but we need your help.What began as an opportunity for Matthew to promote the start of his clothing brand, Cellardoor, has morphed into something much greater. Spending most of his life in management Matthew has long had the dream of inspiring people in a different way; as an artist whose work inspires people to be open minded and live passionately. Lauren has always strived to help the people around her, this drive and determination has led to a successful career as a community based therapeutic counselor. These two lives and ideals have merged into this tour and a creative, inspiring way to not only bring Cellardoor to the masses but to serve as an avenue to volunteer time and effort in communities across the country but we need your help too.
For anyone looking to support Cellardoor, the art, the concept, the belief in helping others, you have the opportunity to start contributing to these causes starting today.
What is Cellardoor?
Cellardoor came to fruition as a way to brand Jawn Johnson's artwork, inspiration, and style into a medium that is accessible to practically everyone.
While I may not be a classically trained artist what I lack in experience is made up for in the love, passion, and emotion that goes into creating a new piece. I want to share that feeling of hope and wonderment - where anything is possible - with as many people as possible. By printing my designs on apparel and traveling the country to promote, I have created the opportunity to connect with a great amount of people. When people wear a Cellardoor design I want them to feel confident about their passions, to take some time and find the beauty in today, and to encourage others to shine in the same way.
Matthew’s Experience.I have spent almost 18 years in the retail industry, the last 5 years as a store manager at a $1.5 million dollar surf and skate shop. During my time there, my teams were always ranked top in the district, region, and company. Spending so many years in this industry I have seen how brands have grown and what have been the leading ideas into getting them produced and sold on a national level. With that said my favorite part of being a manager has always been helping people and teaching my staff how to have fun and be successful at the same time. I must say the relationships I have built through my career are priceless and have developed into friendships I will value my entire life.


These two lives and ideals have merged into this tour and a creative, inspiring way to not only bring Cellardoor to the masses but to serve as an avenue to volunteer time and effort in communities across the country but we need your help too.Lauren’s Experience.I have spent most of my life helping others and have made careers out of my desire to make a difference. My roles have varied - coach, teacher, counselor, director - but my main focus has always been to help improve the lives of others. The majority of my experience has been in the mental health field which has taught me so much about the importance of health and wellness of the human spirit. There are many different factors and ideas that could improve the world we live in but ultimately I think we all need to do a better job of looking out for each other. Matthew and I both agree that understanding and empathy are two traits that are quickly disappearing around us. I have been fortunate enough in my life thus far and it just feels right to give back - in as many different ways as possible.The Tour.Our daily lives will consist of traveling, participating in local art and craft events, a grass roots promotion of Cellardoor and volunteering our time and energy to the greater good. We have just recently hooked up with Volunteer Match and Random Acts of Kindness to help us participate in volunteering events all across the country. Even with their help we are always looking to add new events and hear about the causes our fans are most passionate about. The better job we do at promoting and continuing to create opportunities for Cellardoor the greater our impact will be on communities and passionate individuals all across the country. Contribution breakdown.0-$5000 ---  The closer we get to $5000 will allow for the successful launch of a Cellardoor webstore. We will be able to purchase merchandise in bulk orders including many different options for men and women. Additional costs will include the printing of designs on the merchandise. 
$5000-$10000 --- This will allow Cellardoor to target printers who can handle the capabilities of printing original paintings as Cellardoor designs. Cellardoor will also be able to expand merchandise past T-shirts and hoodies into hats, beanies and other accessories. .
$10000-$20000 --- The end goal will allow Cellardoor to purchase its own printer that will properly transfer elaborate original designs onto merchandise for our growing fan base. Keep in mind when the Cellardoor webstore is up and running we will be able to dedicate a portion of the proceeds to an organization or organizations we will have met and worked with while on tour.How can you support Cellardoor and get something back?For anyone looking to support Cellardoor, the art, the concept, the belief in helping others, you have the opportunity to start contributing to these causes starting today. To help out Cellardoor and the tour share this page, email it to a friend, Tweet about it. The internet is a powerful tool and by sharing your support on social media you will further help our cause and market the Cellardoor brand. In addition please support Cellardoor by choosing one or more of the perks including Cellardoor logo tees and hoodies. You may also choose to purchase an original painting, each with their own unique description, which are also available as 8x10 signed and numbered prints.T-shirt designs 
Please visit the gallery tab above to view all available original paintings that are also available as signed, numbered, and framed 8 x 10 prints.Thank you to everyone for their support.For the first time ever you can shop us online atwww.CellardoorClothing.comAnd for all original artwork and prints from paintings to beautiful landscapes from our cross country tour, check outwww.Etsy.com/shop/SurrealDreamscapes

story:
C Art Gallery opened in 2007 as the anchor tenant of Hiawatha Artist Lofts in Seattle.  The mission of the gallery is to present and promote art and artists of different cultural backgrounds to encourage diversity and promote understanding and positive dialogue.  In the past five years we have opened our doors to over 150 artists including some veterans and many who have had the opportunity to show their work for the first time. 

October 14, 2013 a grease fire started in the residence above the gallery setting off the sprinkler system.  The sprinklers remained on for over an hour and a half causing extreme flooding in the gallery space, damaging work of our resident artist, guest artists, art students and office supplies.  We are in the midst of a rebuilding effort and this campaign is to do our best to be sure the artists affected receive the support they need and the gallery can remain a stable arts venue for diverse artists and cultural art lovers in the Pacific Northwest.

We know that artists put their heart and soul in the work they create.  Your financial support will help purchase the work that was lost and help us recover operating support due to the closure.  Just imagine 150 more artists, students, veterans, young and old who will come through our doors in 2014 because our community of artists, art lovers, family and friends came together to help keep us up, running, creating and supporting the arts.

How the Funds Will Be Used

$12,000 is what we are requesting although the value of the art lost far exceeds this amount.  We have to start somewhere.

$8,000 will restore some of the art damaged by water not covered by insurance.  $1,000 will be used to offset the extreme costs to store the art work that survived while the gallery is under construction and to deliver it back to the gallery upon completion, $1,000 will be used to paint the interior of the gallery to prepare it for reopening and $1,600 will be used to replace office and art supplies to revitalize the gallery when we open fresh and new in 2014. The $400 balance will be used for fees for the campaign to reach people for support and for the gallery opening.

Our commitment is to provide any funds raised first to the artists for their damaged work.

Our Impact

If you had a chance to check out our video or come to our shows you know we serve artists who have very few opportunities to step into the world of art and learn from their peers.  We step out on faith and let the gallery walls serve as an introduction to the diverse artists that live and work in our community and share their culture without inhibition.  Our care and concern for the artists who work with us is solid.  Our desire to remain a part of the arts community unwavering.  Our ideas for moving forward and expanding our space, our programs and art opportunities is on the horizon. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially.  But we are still asking for your help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Go to www.cartgallery.org and join our mailing list to come out and celebrate our grand re-opening in January 2014.
  • If you are an artist whose work will help us achieve our mission send us some jpegs of your work so we can think about you when we get up and running.
  • Do what you can to help this arts community come back, grow and flourish.

 

And that’s all there is to it!

story:
Thankyou for donating to Hard Pill to Swallow. We did not make 100% of our goal but we got close at 86%. Consider donating via Venmo, Cash app or Pay Pal.

In the meanwhile connect with Farr Well via Instagram: @Farr_well

For more info about Hard Pill to Swallow visit: https://www.farrwell.com/hard-pill-to-swallow

 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

HARD PILL TO SWALLOW​: ​Help Us De-stigmatize Mental Health Illness!

OVERVIEW

“​When people are heard, seen, and understood, they begin to heal. When the world practices empathy and understanding, people feel safe enough to be vulnerable. That’s the work: ​Ending the stigma so we can save lives and bring hope to the hopeless​”​. 

- Farrwell

Social Goals

●  Follow the HPTS Launch Facebook Event

●  10,000 Instagram followers

●  10,000 Youtube Subscribers

●  10,000 Facebook likes

●  10,000 Instagram followers

●  10,000 Soundcloud Followers

●  10,000 New email addresses

●  10,000 petition signatures (in honor of Kelly Savage to reduce the use of restraining practices in mental health facilities in Japan.)

Monetary Goals

$6500 

Marketing: $1000

Merchandise: $2500 

Collaborator: $2000 

Education: $1000

OUR PROJECT: Hard Pill to Swallow

Hard Pill to Swallow is a fearlessly personal account of Farr Well’s own life from 2015 to 2020 and deals directly with trauma issues including Bipolar Disorder, paranoia, suicidal thoughts, and gun violence. Farr Well made the new record with producer Sao Mao, who also lives with Bipolar as well and Marcus Kar, the director of Youth Farm Minnesota, an Activist/musician and Veteran. Together, these three minds have crafted an outstanding and impactful piece of true hip-hop that authentically speaks on difficult topics in a way that has the power to create real healing.

Farr Well is using his story to open the door for conversations around mental illness and generational trauma.

Read more about Farington Lewellyn a.k.a Farr Well here:  Farr Well's Bio

WHAT TO EXPECT

"Hard Pill to Swallow" is an album and also a podcast/blog/platform based on having tough conversations and healing. July 17th will be a listening party on zoom APP, followed by a Q&A style panel discussion on mental illness & generational trauma. hosted by mental health practitioners & trauma experts.

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

❖ Marketing: $1000 ( Paid promotions for raising awareness & maximizing exposure)

❖ Merchandise: $2500 ( $1200 for CDs, $1000 clothing, $300 stickers, gift bags etc.)

❖ Artist/ Collaborator: $2000 ( Graphic designers, Painters, Musicians, Engineer, Guest speakers and other contributors)

❖ Education: $1000 (workshops and mental health training. Farr Well has been attending online classes to expand his advocacy work)


You can help us by:

●  Giving us constructive suggestions

●  Sharing the link of this campaign on your social media pages {awareness of our project is as important as every penny}

●  Referring like-minded people to this campaign pages

story:
Bath bombs and shower fizzies designed after the iconic images that we all know and love!

I love baths, and I love awesome baths. I noticed, though, that there is a gap in the bath product world for awesome, geeky items that people who love video games and comics would really enjoy. So, I decided to design my own line of bath bombs and shower fizzies for those who felt the same way! That's why I made my company- Fizzy Fairy Apothecary! The video above only talks about the Pokeball Bath Bombs, which I wanted to start with because they are so iconic.  I have decided to extend the line to My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic inspired pokeballs as well!

The Pokeball inspired bath bombs will not only look like Pokeballs, but each and every one of them will have a Pokemon toy inside that will reveal itself once you fizz the bath bomb in your tub! These are a little more expensive than the Pony bath bombs for that reason. The shower fizzies will not have these toys, since they are too small to hold them inside. NOTE: the original Pokeball bath bombs do turn your water red, as do any with red in them, so keep that in mind if you find the idea of bathing in red water creepy! These bath bombs/shower fizzies also contain oils, so please message me if you are allergic to sweet almond oil so I can make sure yours are made with grapeseed oils.

The cost of making so many of these is too large for me to take on myself- these costs include not only the materials for the bath bombs, which can add up quickly with large amounts of fragrance oils, but also for packaging material, business cards and labels, and molds for the bombs themselves. 

I plan on releasing a set of six different Pokeballs, which will be sold together and separately. These pokeballs (and their scents) will be: 

Regular Pokeball- Japanese Cherry Blossom
Ultra Ball- Lemon Verbena
Net Ball- Sea Spray
Great Ball- Blueberry Cobbler
Quick Ball- Oatmeal Milk and Honey
Master Ball- Ancient Musk

For the My Little Pony side of the bath bombs, there will be two sets: the villians/heroes and the mane six. 

Fluttershy- Fresh Spring
Pinkie Pie- Birthday Cake
Rarity- Confidence
Twilight Sparkle- Magic Potion
Apple Jack- Spiced Apples
Rainbow Dash- Rainbow

and:

Princess Celestia- White Tea and Ginger
Princess Luna- Lavender Relaxation
Princess Cadence- Wedding Day
Discord- Absinthe
Chrysalis- Witching Hour
Alicorn Amulet Trixie- Black Magic

Check out my Facebook page, Fizzy Fairy Apothecary, for more information and photos! Once this campaign is funded, I'll also be opening up an Etsy store with these and other bath creations. 

Etsy prices: you're getting a deal with these perks, because once the store launches and I'm selling the bath bombs on there, each one will be priced at $4.50 per bath bomb plus shipping, which can be around $5. 

Scents:

Japanese Cherry Blossom- a well rounded blend of pink Japanese cherry blossoms and fragrant mimosa, with bottom notes of vanilla, tonka bean, and oriental woods

Lemon Verbena-  A zesty bold lemon softened with a herbal verbena leaf type scent.

Sea Spray- Strong top notes of sea salt, ocean mist and aquatic florals blend with base notes of sea greenery, fresh air and soft musk.

Blueberry Cobbler- Juicy blueberries with freshly ground cinnamon, butter and vanilla.

Oatmeal Milk and Honey- Raw oats, almond, soy milk and a kiss of honey.

Ancient Musk- Hints of vanilla sweeten this scent comprised of fresh orange, warm woods, and musk. Patchouli, cedar wood, sandalwood and light notes of rose balance out this fragrance. 

Fresh Spring-  Newly sprouted garden greens, soft kisses of gentle mint and light, airy spring florals lay gently on background notes of white musk and soft sandalwood.

Birthday Cake- Rich and moist cake notes blend with creamy vanilla and sweet frosting.

Confidence- Italian bergamot, hints of tobacco flower, Asian Lily, warm oak moss and star jasmine blend with damask plum, cashmere woods, patchouli and french vanilla cream. This scent is sexy and understated.

Magic Potion-  Mandarin orange and Japanese grapefruit blend with strong notes of georgia peach, nubian musk, magnificent plum and soft rose petals. A truly magical blend !

Spiced Apples- Country orchard apples baked with cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla and clove.

Rainbow A base of misty white musk supports top notes of crisp pear, kiwi, raspberry, grape and peach. Notes of lily of the valley and sweet jasmine round this scent out beautifully.

White Tea and Ginger-  White tea, lemon, yuzu, clean florals and spicy ginger in a harmonius blend.

Lavender Relaxation- A calming and relaxing blend of fresh lavender softened beautifully with a gentle white musk and a gentle kiss of soft powder notes as a background.

Wedding Day- Romance abounds with top notes of apricot and pear, middle notes of orchid and bird of paradise and rounded out with sandalwood, musk and English ivy.

Absinthe- Star anise, amber, spicy cinnamon, fresh green herbal notes blended with fennel, nutmeg and cassia laid down on a bed of woodsy accords.

Witching Hour-  This mysterious scent combines freshly ground cinnamon bark with earthy notes of musk, black tea and patchouli. This scent is rounded out with jasmine, cannabis and bergamot.

Black Magic- Ylang ylang, eathy sandalwood, patchouli and vanilla blend with strong mysterious notes of baby powder.

UPDATE: now that the goal has been reached, and with a few days before the deadline, I decided to add three more bath bombs to the list! 

~Hello, I'm the Doctor. Now run! (Ninth Doctor, scent of Oud Wood: 
Warm and mysterious. Sensual, dark oud wood dominates the top of this woodsy fragrance and then the drydown balances it out with soft amber and white jasmine.)
~Allons-y! (Tenth Doctor, scent of Cocobolo Wood: Think beautiful rich rosewood with a slight rose scent.)
~Bow Ties Are Cool! (Eleventh Doctor, scent of Satsuma, both uplifting and energizing! A sweet, aromatic citrus blend of orange, mandarin, mango, jasmine, lime, peach and orange flowers.)

Thank you all again!

story:
Welcome and thank you for visiting my very first campaign!
After countless hours of drawing and planning,
I present to you...


✦ 6 Starting Characters: Kratos, Lloyd, Zelos, Colette, Yuan, Mithos
✦ The pins measure 2.5x3 cm with gold plating and a black rubber clutch on the back.
✦ Lloyd and Noishe measure 5.3 cm
✦ I have lovingly illustrated and designed a unique backing card for each character pin, inspired by the  z-skits from the game.
✦ Last but not least, I'm bringing back the purple bubble mailers. It felt really wrong not to use them.



GOAL ACHIEVED! - Bonus Kratos Stickers for all Judgment perks and above
GOAL ACHIEVED! - Unlocks Sheena Skit Pin, Available on ALL perks, added bonus for all Dad perks
GOAL ACHIEVED! - Unlocks Material Blades Pin, Available on ALL perks, added bonus for all Dad perks
GOAL ACHIEVED! - Unlocks SECRET PIN, Limited to this campaign only! Available on ALL perks. *This design is NOT a bonus unless exchanged with another pin*

Sheena and the Material Blades will be Aselia Con 2020! Lloyd and Noishe design is campaign-only!

The remaining stock, if any, will be available for purchase after the con in my online shop... which I will reveal when the time comes.
 


✦ I will collect your choice of pins when my campaign ends via a Google form that I will email to everyone. When signing up on this site, please use an email address where I can reach you. That's the one they're gonna give me.

✦ I will be selling the pins in limited quantities at Aselia Con 2020! Please note that I won't have these pins up for sale forever since I prefer to do preorders. If you want some cool pins, it would be wise to order now!

✦ Additional pins will be available as an Add-On Perk for 15 USD each.


✦ 75% - Production costs of these 6 characters + 3 stretch goal designs
✦ 15% - Shipping Worldwide
✦ 10% - Running the campaign on this site, Packaging costs


✦ Early December: Campaign Launch
✦ December 31st: Campaign Ends
✦ December 31st-January 3rd: Choose your designs via Google Form, place order with manufacturer. Please respond promptly, the time crunch is real now.
✦ February: Pins arrive for inspection, then my life is packing/shipping
✦ March: Finish packing/shipping all orders


I have a decade of experience in paper printing, but I'm new to pins! Because of that, I have spent months researching and ordered physical samples of the pins and the backing cards to inspect.

I will be ordering extra to ensure everyone gets the best quality pins. Each one will be different and from what I gather in my research, some imperfections are to be expected. I am aware of which types of imperfections are considered unacceptable and will not be selling those pins at full price. The worst that could happen is that I will need to order more to replace the unacceptable pins, causing shipping delays. I will update y'all as they come.

story:
I think it is very important to bring the past into focus when viewing through the artistic lens of the Photographer. To see the fragment of nature and to feel its essence and the importance of the moment. With photography, it all comes back to our memory, but with a richer and more meaningful appearance.  
 
Greetings! My name is Alexei Svinarski (Lyosha). I am a 54 year old painter and photographer as well as the founder of a non-profit photography museum called the Urbana Museum of Photography (UMoP) located in Urbana, IL.
 
After over two years of brainstorming and careful planing, in May of 2012, I opened the doors of the Urbana Museum of Photography. Apart from being a viewing area and showroom, the Museum is also structured as a small multifaced institution, covering Education, History, Art and Community as well as other fields of interest.
 
With high ambitions, UMoP emphasizes traditional analog photography, considering it as an Art Form. -- teaching a Photo Class for kids ages 7 to 14 as well as holding workshops on pinhole cameras, tintypes , Dark Room processing and more. The space allows for simultaneous display of two different bodies of works  - the permanent collection of historic photographs of Urbana, IL (1800s-1900s) and contemporary regional and international photographic works.
 
In the first year of UMoP's existence, we held several field trips and workshops on the art of photography, we hosted 8 exhibitions of photographs by a total of 29 different artists from around the world. In response, we were also able to achieve recognition from numerous publications and were interviewed by local media and public radio stations. We have several hundred followers on our FB page and so far have received 100% positive feedback from the community.
 
UMoP has manageded to operate through 2012 and 2013, partially by a personal loan and partially by my own professional income. With the expansion of our children's classes, our ever growing show openings and workshops we have reached a plateau, a point in which we need help from you all to be able to continue to grow not only the Museum but the Urbana Art Comminity as a whole.
 
My major concerns are rent and utilities for the year, as well as the costs for a non-profit status. Roughly $15,000 is needed for us to grow into where we need to be.
 
Through your contributions, we can finalize the Little School of Photography as well as continue to grow as a vital resource for our community.
 
UMoP is the first and the only Museum of Photography in Champaign County, IL. Unfortunately, we do not have other previous models to follow, so we create as we go. After the few coming years of existence, we will be the model for somebody else to follow.
 
Please help us to continue our journey, contribute if you can, but also help us to spread the word, share it. 
 
Thank You for all of your great support!
 
Sincerely, with much love, 
Lyosha Svinarski
Founder/Owner of UMoP.
 
PS: I am determined to bring this institution up to the fully performing level by taking it to the next step, - the Little School of Photography. 
Obsession parallels personal artistic obligations for our society, thank YOU all. 
 
You can find us as 'Urbana Museum of Photography' on Google or Facebook.
 
"Photography is a way of feeling, of touching, of loving. What you have caught on film is captured forever ... it remembers little things long after you have forgotten everything." 
-Aaron Siskind
 
P.P.S Your contributions come with gifts from us to you. Please select from the following 'perks' on the right hand side of this page. 
 
$25 -- A thank you from us to you for your awesome contribution and your support for our growth.
 
$50 -- Silver Memory
8"x10" limited edition Silver Gelatin Fiber Print, autographed in pencil
 
$100 -- Analog Freak
BEAUTIFUL limited edition 11"x14" Silver Gelatin Fiber Print, autographed in pencil
 
$500 -- The Patron
11"x 14" Silver Gelatin limited edition print, matted and signed, framed in 16"x20" glass frame.

story:
"California Landscape" 24 x 30 inch original framed painting by Jeff Sojka

I have been a full time professional artist for the last 16 years. I love plein air painting, or "painting on location". I enjoy being able to be out in nature and trying to capture the light and feeling of the day. My work is shown in galleries in California, Park City, Utah, Aspen, Colorado, Bar Harbor, Maine, and the Big Island of Hawaii.

 

What are my inspirations?

 

When I was 16 years old, I was fortunate to be awarded a scholarship to study in Europe. I was able to travel thoughout Europe and witness the great museums of Germany, France, Spain, Belgium, the Netherlands, Austria, Switzerland, and Italy. I was mesmerized by the art, the people, and the amazing variation of landscape.

"Colorful Cliffs", original painting of the Cinque Terra, Italy

 

I came back, went to college and graduate school and then became obsessed with plein air painting, especially the California impressionists, and in particular, the work of Edgar Payne.

 

It is these inspirations that made me want to go on an extended 5 month trip to Europe. My hope is to inspire my 6 year old daughter Natalie, to expose her to the great museums and architecture, as well as people and cultures. We will be following in the footsteps of Edgar Payne, when he traveled to France, Switzerland, and Italy. - trying to capture with my own style, the same magical vistas that he had seen years ago. We will also be making our way through England, and Ireland, as well as Germany, Spain, Slovenia, and Croatia. It is my hope to enrich our lives with new experiences and new inspiration for painting. I will be making numerous sketches, tons of small painting studies, and also larger pieces as we travel thoughout the trip.

The culmination of all this work will be a hardcover book highlighting select images from the travels and an exhibit that will be held in Aspen, Colorado at the prestigious Elliott Yeary Gallery in July of 2014.

Maroon Bells, Aspen, Colorado

 



 

6 x 6 study for a coastal painting.

 

6 x 6 study for the "California Landscape" painting.

 

6 x6 study for a moon painting with a shooting star.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, we are MA students graduating this year from the School of Media, Film and Music at Sussex University. Every generation in this school has to showcase their works in a small gathering at the end of their programme.

But we are not the kind to settle for less:

'Stories and Spaces' is the first Postgraduate Media and Film Degree Show from Sussex University that aims not only to showcase the latest work, but also to evaluate it by having it judged by four leading professionals from the film and media industry: Daisy Asquith, Penny Woolcock, Mark Francis and Simon Fanshawe. 

It also proposes to provide a meeting platform in between the industry and the graduates, by also being a self-standing networking event. The directors of the four best films chosen by the jury, will receive one-year subscriptions to Shooting People and short internships in award winning production companies Touch Productions and Back2back Productions. 

But in order to make this happen, we need your help!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our funds application was awarded with a sum that only covers half of our budget. In order to be able to pay for printing the Degree Show catalogues and posters, as well as the rent for the event location, we need to raise another 1000 GBP by the 1st of September. 

Any sum of money will work though, as we are trying to first cover location costs: 650 GBP. The rest of 350 would go towards printing 200 poster-leaflets with the programe of the evening and about 100 catalogues with the full description of our projects and contact information. 
 
The initial numbers for printing were 400 posters and 200 catalogues, but we are aware this would imply more than 1000 GBP (1570 US Dollars)

 

The Impact

Finding a job after graduation can be very challenging, especially during recession. This event attempts to introduce the graduates to the Media and Film Industry, and offer them the valuable experience of presenting their work in a professional environment. 

Even more so, it has not been easy but we are having as competition judges internationally acclaimed documentary film-makers and media icons like Daisy Asquith (http://www.daisyasquith.co.uk/#/awards/4524420020), Penny Woolcock (http://www.pennywoolcock.co.uk/cv/), Mark Francis (http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2126549/) and Simon Fanshawe (http://simonfanshawe.com/?page_id=12). 

Four of us will leave the evening with a short intership awarded, and many more with future job interviews.

We believe in quality work, we have youth's enthusiasm and energy, and we are eager to get out there and reward you with great films!

Support us and we promise to give you good entertainment, both on the evening and for the rest of our future careers!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word and come to our event. You'll want to hire us after the evening.

story:
VISION

Classical Drawing Academy will use modern technology to deliver a proven drawing curriculum in the atelier tradition. Drawing is an intensely personal form of expression and the foundation of working in any visual medium, from oil painting to game design. By helping students reach their full potential as artists, Classical Drawing Academy will be transformative on both a personal and professional level.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

You can help Classical Drawing Academy reach its fundraising goal of $8,000 by clicking on one of the following perks listed on the right side of this page. You can also donate any amount, large or small, directly to the Academy through PayPal at www.classicaldrawing.com/donate.

The donation amount for items to be shipped includes shipping within the continental United States; for others we will contact you regarding shipping costs.

This illustrated PDF will help you establish good drawing habits! These tips teach basic mark-making technique, showing what to do, and what not to do, when drawing any subject. They are especially helpful for drawing the human figure.

This signed 20-page 8" x 10" booklet is an informal collection of artistic anatomy notes taken by Classical Drawing Academy founder Christopher Tsongas, primarily in Matt Buckner's courses at Gage Academy of Art.

This is a small 5” x 5” signed limited edition print of a cast drawing by Classical Drawing Academy founder Christopher Tsongas. The print is framed and can be hung on a wall or set on any flat surface.

This is a signed limited edition print of a portrait drawn from a costumed model by Classical Drawing Academy founder Christopher Tsongas. The print is 8" x 10" and framed for hanging on a wall.

Pre-register at a 50% discount for the six-month Classical Drawing Academy course opening January 1st, 2015! This discount will ONLY be available during this crowdfunding campaign. Registrants will receive instructions for preparing for the course.

This is a signed original graphite drawing by Classical Drawing Academy founder Christopher Tsongas. Drawn from a live model at Georgetown Atelier in Seattle and presented in a gorgeous custom frame selected by the artist.

Classical Drawing Academy will solicit applications and carefully select a motivated and well-qualified recipient for a full-tuition scholarship. The scholarship can be anonymous or awarded in your name or the name of your organization.

Classical Drawing Academy founder Christopher Tsongas will personally travel to your location and teach a weekend workshop featuring two full days of intensive drawing instruction for you or your group. Includes travel within the United States.

WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES

Your donation or purchase of a perk supports the development of Classical Drawing Academy! The following chart shows a breakdown of how funds will be utilized.

THE CURRICULUM

Classical Drawing Academy leads students through a structured six-month curriculum with four modules. Together, these modules teach a process that can be used to draw any subject. Students who complete all four modules receive a Certificate of Completion from Classical Drawing Academy.

Module One: Setup

The first module has three chapters about setting yourself up for success with the right materials, workspace, and body mechanics. It covers exactly which supplies to purchase and how to use them, plus how to set up a home or professional studio environment. While proper setup may require some adjustment, it eliminates struggle and frustration with the fundamental aspects of drawing so students can focus on building higher level skills.

Module Two: Block-In

A block-in is the first stage of a drawing. It looks like a two-dimensional blueprint and guides the completion of the drawing. The second module has four chapters that teach students how to draw a compelling and accurate block-in. These four chapters cover gesture, composition, perspective and anatomy. Together these chapters give students the tools to design and create an interpretation of our three-dimensional world on a flat piece of paper.

Module Three: Rendering

Rendering is the process of adding light, shadow and fine detail to a block-in, thereby producing a finished drawing. The four chapters of the rendering module cover shadow shapes, core shadows, highlights and halftones. Students are introduced to these concepts by drawing a gradient plus a simple object, then progress to successively more challenging subjects by working from photographs of a plaster cast and then the human figure.

Module Four: Thesis

For the thesis project students integrate everything learned during the course by developing a concept, setting up and lighting a still life, and completing a drawing. The thesis module also covers photographing work for reproduction or publishing online, and framing a drawing.

WHO IS CHRISTOPHER TSONGAS?

After experiencing years of frustration trying to improve my drawing skills, I discovered classical training in Seattle and attended classes at Pratt Fine Arts Center, Gage Academy of Art, The Seattle Sculpture Atelier and Georgetown Atelier. I am starting Classical Drawing Academy to bring the benefits of this classical training to other artists.

Successfully creating Classical Drawing Academy will require a diverse skill set, including producing instructional videos and building a web site. Fortunately, my first career was in the film industry. I earned an MFA from the USC School of Cinematic Arts, and did production work on movies including Kindergarten Cop and Point Break. I also did visual effects at studios including Sony Pictures and Laika. My filmmaking background, plus my professional experience teaching diverse subjects such as sculpting, computer programming, and yoga, means I am up to the task of shooting and editing high-quality instructional videos.

Delivering the Classical Drawing Academy course online will make it accessible to students wherever they live, on their own schedule, and for a price much lower than the cost of attending a traditional brick and mortar atelier. I have a BS in Computer Science and my second career has been in website development and hosting, so I have the background and experience necessary to deliver the Classical Drawing Academy curriculum online.

Earlier this year I attended The Representational Art Conference in Ventura, California and saw interest in classical art education is increasing worldwide. It is my hope that Classical Drawing Academy will join the growing number of ateliers and online resources dedicated to classical training. Please join this exciting movement by supporting my fundraising campaign!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Please share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter, and email a link to a friend!

After experiencing years of frustration trying to improve my drawing skills, I discovered classical training in Seattle and attended classes at Pratt Fine Arts Center, Gage Academy of Art, The Seattle Sculpture Atelier and Georgetown Atelier. I am starting Classical Drawing Academy to bring the benefits of this classical training to other artists.
Successfully creating Classical Drawing Academy will require a diverse skill set, including producing instructional videos and building a web site. Fortunately, my first career was in the film industry. I earned an MFA from the USC School of Cinematic Arts, and did production work on movies including Kindergarten Cop and Point Break. I also did visual effects at studios including Sony Pictures and Laika. My filmmaking background, plus my professional experience teaching diverse subjects such as sculpting, computer programming, and yoga, means I am up to the task of shooting and editing high-quality instructional videos.
Delivering the Classical Drawing Academy course online will make it accessible to students wherever they live, on their own schedule, and for a price much lower than the cost of attending a traditional brick and mortar atelier. I have a BS in Computer Science and my second career has been in website development and hosting, so I have the background and experience necessary to deliver the Classical Drawing Academy curriculum online.
Earlier this year I attended The Representational Art Conference in Ventura, California and saw interest in classical art education is increasing worldwide. It is my hope that Classical Drawing Academy will join the growing number of ateliers and online resources dedicated to classical training. Please join this exciting movement by supporting my fundraising campaign! 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Please share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter, and email a link to a friend!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Amoré and I am an upcoming makeup artist in Houston, Texas. Me entire life has revolved around art and making people smile. All through out middle and high school I was dedicated to my art classes, doodles, and sketches. It wasn't until my Junior year of High School that I decided to deem cosmetics as my official "favorite" medium of art. Not only that, but I've always felt such gratification from making people laugh, smile, or just feel better about themselves or their day in general. Artistically applying makeup gives me a feeling that I could never explain. So many different colors to choose from, blending them all so perfectly together, and the best part of all is that I can do this on a canvas that can actually emotionally show happiness as the result of my work. My perfect canvas is the skin of a person. Not only do I get the pleasure of creating art on a bride on her wedding day, a model for her headshots to be seen around the world, or just anyone wanting their face painted - I also get the pleasure of making people feel more beautiful than they already are. That happiness is something that I am always extremely grateful for!

What We Need & What You Get

"RAW: natural born artist" is an independant arts organization that is not only FOR artists, but its run BY artists. This organization hand picked me and asked me to showcase my work. The only way that RAW can keep showcasing local artists and their amazing artwork is by selling tickets. In order for me to showcase my makeup artistry, I need to sell 20 tickets @ $10 a ticket. So that's $200 to get me IN the showcase. On top of that, I just found out that I will be doing the makeup of 20+ models that are in the fashion portion of the show. This calculates to $300 for *enough makeup, lashes, and other various cosmetic products for a large number of people.

If I am not able to raise all the money needed (or if I exceed the amount needed) for this showcase, the money will go to marketing my business to greater hights!

The Impact

Being able to be in the RAW showcase will help my business in more ways than I could ever imagine. Since I just started my makeup company in April, I am a partime medical assistant for three hours a day, and the rest of the day I am a mommy and trying to promote my business in the most reasonably (free) priced way possible. It's very difficult to get my name out there just via the internet or flyers. There will be scouts and all kinds of other people that could help me get my career going. Not only that, but RAW has an Annual Indie Awards Show for their top artists. The winners receive big career-boosting prizes like distribution, store placement, studio time, gallery placement and consultations with industry executives and professionals. I need to prove to myself, my daughter, family, friends, and everyone else... that dreams are NEVER a waste of time! If you put your mind to it, you can do and be anything your heart desires! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to make a donation, thank you for taking the time to read my story anyways! Your time is appreciated more than you'll know. Please share my story in hopes that I can begin to live my dreams! Share on Facebook, Twitter, any social networking sites. If you want, write someone some snail mail and just drop them a line about a struggling artist's campaign!

story:
21st June, 2013 Hartshill, Warwickshire

A Manuscript, that traveled around the world in a five years epic journey. A global collaboration of 91 artists. This campaign allows its author to carry it on foot to its conclusion in Cyprus, where it is eagerly awaited by the Cypriot media and galleries. A successful journey will be followed by a further campaign to secure its international publication.

My name is Halkios. I am a poet, amateur photographer and web designer. I have also experimented with video art and I have worked with different genres of music: combining poetry, photography and music, to express my spiritual anxieties.  I have never published anything on paper before.  Mostly, I have been sharing these anxieties in social networks. Many of my art work today finds shelter in the pages of the Halkography website.  All my work has gradually lead to the project I present you; the project of the Diary of an Angel.

THE PROJECT

The project is one of a kind, a very unique art form in itself. It is a highly original concept, both abstract and concrete. It is genuine and enlightening. It is an art book, a manuscript, a valuable collection of images, sound and music, of poetry and prose. It is a documentary which gives both contributor and artists the ability to communicate and revaluate their beliefs on human collaboration and vision. 

ITS JOURNEY

It has travelled around the world for five years, and so far 73 of them have written inside, placing their memories and dreams in the art form they represent. This includes poets, musicians, painters, spoken word artists, writers, lyricists, composers, singers, artisans, photographers, video artists, copywriters, radio presenters, video editors, a bell chimer and a luthier (lute/bouzouki maker).  (For more please visit The Diary of an Angel.)

 

ITS VISION

The Diary of an Angel combines the ancient and the modern; it also explores the concepts of individuality and universality. The art dedicated to this project is already much more that the leather bound pages of the book that it revolves around. It grew like a human child who has almost passed through adolescence and is waiting for  his/her rite of passage.  There is vision.

 ACHIEVEMENTS

This Project is divided in four parts. So far the first two have already reached their goal in the past seven years by contacting and befriending 91 artists who have joined my adventure (please visit the webpage Angel's Nest, the chronicle of the first part, and the webpage City of Gold to understand the concept of the second part and read about each artist). Please visit the Trail of Dawn which is a chronicle of the Journey thus far, in the United States, Europe, and many other places around the world.

 

The next two parts forthcoming will consist of the completion of the journey and an exhibition, and the publication of the Diary and possibly a concert, all of which require funding. The total cost to complete these last two parts of the project is estimated to be US$ 42.4k (~32k € / ~£27.3k) and so it has been decided to split this into two campaigns, considering the urgency and time constraints on the first part. So this campaign is targeted to fund the last leg of the Journey which is:

  • - To visit the last 18 artists in person and allow them to contribute their work in the Diary. It is my hope to celebrate the fifth year anniversary  (1st of August, 2013) by achieving the milestone of the completion of the Diary.
  • - To bring the completed Diary to its permanent home in Cyprus with a symbolic journey on foot, where I will circumnavigate the island, walking a distance of approx. 466 miles (750km), visiting 91 places of historical significance in all six districts such as archaeological sites temples, churches, mosques, schools, museums and galleries in less than a month, covering approx. 19 miles (30km) per day starting from the highest mountain (Troodos) and around the coast visiting the five capes and ending in Polis Chrysohous in the Akama peninsula (please visit The Land of Venus). 

As I walk I will narrate the story of the City of Gold, its relationship with the Diary and its journey, and will take you on an exploration of 91 places in Cyprus, and present each corresponding artist and chapter from the Diary. You will have the opportunity to witness this live by going to the first page of the website Prolegomena. 

The footage from all these days will be edited in a documentary with narrations in three languages and it will be included in the published Diary. At this point I will return to the capital, Nicosia and end this part with a seven day exhibition of the Diary in the gallery of Argo.

It will exhibit the manuscript, the painting and the chest, and many of the artworks of the painters and artisans who have contributed to the Diary. At this point I will produce a CD and a DVD including all musical and video contributions to the Diary, and also make prints of the works of the painters Giclée or on canvas (see available perks on the right). 

Those contributing to the campaign may choose to have their name appearing on the website of Halkography (please visit Artistic Siblings) and may also use that website to follow the progress of the journey and eventual publication of the Diary. 

What We Need & What You Get

For this campaign I need to raise a total US$ 15k (~11.3k € / ~£9.9k) to realize this part of the project, broken down as follows, so I can provide you the music of the musicians involved, a 3 hours documentary of the landscapes of Cyprus, interracting with the local art world, to bring you close with her history to see live through my eyes and hear with my ears, the voices, the sounds and visit with me up to 91 places of Cyprus.

A. Travel Expenses

I need to travel in London, Greece, (Kozani, Athens) Crete (Herakleion), Israel (Ilania) and all six districts of Cyprus in the next three months. I will also need supplies and resources to accomblish the journey walking on the island for 28 days.

B. Production Expences

I am working closely with a recording studio and content publishers to produce a CD and a DVD featuring music and video of the Diary. There are basically four stages of these costs: production, pre-mastering (authoring, encoding, and formatting), applying the narration and subtitles, and finally the mastering and publication. It will contain:

  • A documentary Odoiporiko with Greek, Turkish and English narration and choice of subtitles.
  • 72 min. of music from the Diary (13 to 17 musical pieces).

By asking you to buy your copy or copies before they're printed, we not only make sure we don't waste resources by producing exactly the number we need, but we save money—for you, and for The Diary of an Angel.

C. Technical Expences

Contributions to the campaign will also be used to provide the equipment and technical support needed to produce a video recording of my journey through Cyprus and facilitate a live broadcast as I walk.

 The Campaign

If this campaign is succesful, we will start another campaign to finance the publication of the Diary. Those who contribute $50 or more to this campaign, will be eligible to purchase the Diary at 50% off.

If the campaign does not reach the goal, priority will be given to the funding necessary to complete the Diary and present it to Cyprus as a gift. Production of the CD/DVD and video/webcast of the Journey through Cyprus is contigent upon the succes of the campaign.

The Impact

The Diary will remind people of the importance of keeping conventional art alive and available, and that technology is here to serve us and not us to serve technology. – Whereas a button can delete blogs and the works of thousand artists, dismissing the passion and work they had put into both physical and mentally, a Diary, or a painting can keep word and art and sheets of music for much longer. It is tangible and permanent. Keeping the balance between the two worlds is essential for humankind to come into peace with their needs both pshysical and spiritual.

Art is an expression of honesty and freedom, the Diary being a manuscript expresses itself without fear of being copied, pasted dragged and dropped.

First and foremost most its importance lies in its message. It has been written to spread the message of unconditional love and friendship.

 

Musicians

Fiona Joy Hawkins

Aviram Freiberg

Lorrie Sarafin

Aggelos Kalorizikakis

Kostas B. Hades

Dusk

Nikos Mihas

Neil White

Kostas Babaletsos

Mihalis Lekkakos

Aytunç Akdoğu

Dervis Barbaros

Aysun Kahraman

 

Spoken word artists

Jack Young

Colleen Keller Breuning

 

Sign word artists

Miro Civin

 

Artists

Efi Andrianou

Chrysanthi Farmaka

Athina Antoniadou

Laurynas Stankevicius

Rosie Daffern

Alex Weaver

Fiona Joy Hawkins

Lana Deym Campbell

Semra Bayhanli

Alba Hernández Abrego

Nancy Lee

Jeff Glenn

Steven Glenn

 

Narrators

Demetrios Fyrios

Dervis Barbaros

Halkios

 

Useful Links

They are several links below to facilitate the proper introduction of the project, learn more about it from me, from them and our fans.

All of its contributors, the 91 and all those who helped me untill now.

The Official pages of the The Diary of an Angel Group in Facebook,

Our pages in Facebook

The Diary of an Angel Page

Thunderbuss

Halkios

Halkography

The Official Webpage Halkography

The Youtube Page The Angel's Nest

I will be in your disposal to answer questions regarding the Project at my personal page in Facebook : Halkios

Other Ways You Can Help

I will be grateful if you can share the Links above to more people. "Like" the pages in Facebook or "Tweet" where possible and specialy from this page!

Note: Under its page in the Official Website there are sharing buttons for

Facebook, Twitter, Google, Pinterest, LinkedIn

Direct links to five Contributors that can also spend their time to explain to you about the project are:

Maryann Corrigan  (from floor 7) representing the poets

Mary and Francis Young (from floor 3) representing the Messengers

Efi Andrianou (from floor 1) representing the Cypriot painters

Derviş Barbaros (from floor 1) representing Turkish speakers

 

Thank you!
