story_txt:
MOENA IS OFF TO JAPAN..

Hi! My name is Alexandra
Murcott and I create art under the pseudonym Moena Moxham.

I am a Surface Designer based in Wellington, New Zealand.I forge bronze sculptures, etch glass, illustrate and draw things!I
was excited to come across the crowd-funding website indiegogo.com because it
gives me the opportunity to show my art to a wider audience while raising money
from selling my art to fund my next venture. To follow my dream, I’m going to
need a bit of extra help… but keep reading- I think you may want to join the
ride…
‘Keep Your Head in the Clouds’  - Hand cut
and etched glass vase
It
has been a dream of mine for many years to travel to Japan and experience a
culture that has inspired and informed my life and work. I have attempted to
get there three times and due to different reasons and obstacles, been foiled
each time. Four years ago I focused on what I needed in order to be able to
achieve this target, and began to prioritize my goals and aspirations. From
then on I have been preparing myself mentally and physically to make this goal
present in reality… the time is now!

I
am crowd funding to travel to Japan over the 2014/15 snow season and beyond! I
have packed up everything in New Zealand to embark on an Art/ snow journey of a
lifetime, leaving NZ in January 2015. I am seeking new experiences in every shape and form; sparking inspiration
for my next collection of work. I would love to find places to exhibit in
Japan. This is all while meeting other people who adore life and adventure as
much as I do!

          ‘Out of the Dog Box’                         'Regina'                             ‘Cluster F&%#K’
We
all experience challenges in life- and I have overcome some enormous ones- but
what I have learnt from this is you have to do what makes you happy; what makes
you tick and get zingy with excitement. Because when you do- you spread an
energy that infects everyone around you to get up and do what they love too;
from this all sorts of amazing creative things start happening!
'Love Cuts Deep’ – bronze & glass(I
want to make these x500 to scale! Piercing the land so that people look up to
them…)
Snowboarding
is one of my biggest passions. I love being in the outdoors, the cold air in
the mountains; meeting other people who love similar and different things, and
finding new and interesting phenomenon to challenge myself and learn from.
Guess what?!- Apart from being culturally awesome from every angle- Japan has
one of the biggest amounts of snowfall, of any country in the world and a
culture of snow lovers like no other!
Snowboarding
has taught me skills and reinforced metaphors for living life. It’s a sport
that requires good judgment, honesty, and a realistic appraisal of ones skills,
abilities and expectations. It’s about managing challenges and adapting to your
surroundings, situations and environment. One step in front of the other eeks
further forwards; not only making progress for yourself but also making it
easier for the person who follows. It never fails to amaze me how each day can
be so different, and that when you stop stressing things- it all falls into
place.

Summit of Mt Ruapehu- Crater Lake August
2014
It’s
about assessing honestly your mental and physical state and not being so hard
on yourself. It’s risk assessment, judgment calls and planning. You have days
where it all comes together, days that fall apart, days which change from start
to finish and ones which are completely unexpected.

Some
days the ride and the afternoon can be the bonus; just getting up in the
morning and on the chairlift or into the mountains I have achieved. For me it
puts my life in perspective and simplifies it to the basics.
‘Keep Your Head in the Clouds’
I
love getting up, out and doing things. In a society that is increasingly dominated
with messages and images about how we should look, I want to reinforce how
amazing we all are when our healthy bodies can go out and DO. Check out some of
my latest adventures here on my BLOG
I am going to hike
new mountains, wakeboard new waters, ride new slopes, bathe on new beaches
& motor new roads while taking on new challenges with gusto!
'Who’s Left Holding the Baby’      ‘Semi Permanent’                 ‘Hangin in Da Wood’
While in Tokyo I
intend to visit Mizuma Art Gallery, Take Ninagawa, Mori Art Museum, Wako Works
of Art, SCAI The Bathhouse, Hara Museum of Contemporary Art to name a few, and other art events along the way. I am so excited
to get to the historic Mecca of Kyoto and to travel to Naoshima- an island
dedicated to contemporary art and sculpture. I predominantly will be
snowboarding in Hakuba and the Nagano prefecture. While in Hakuba I hope to get
to the Saegusa
Art Gallery which has over 100 oil and water paintings focusing on the Hakuba
landscape. The Hakuba Museum of Art is also on my get to list. 

                    ‘Dreams Baby’                                                 ‘BOOM
the Mercedes’
On
the 19th of Sept 2013, I held an exhibition at my studio in
Wellington, New Zealand- if I return to New Zealand, I aim to use this space,
or another suitable at home or overseas to invite artists form Japan and the
world to exhibit with me. On the 28th of November 2014 I am part of
a sculpture exhibition with the New Zealand Academy of Fine Arts and the Life
Education Trust and will use this event to explore other opportunities.
                              
                                             ‘Indelible’ - Hand painted wooden vase
Our
world is becoming increasingly reliant on social media to form relationships,
friendships and connections. Nothing compares to really being there. I like to
get out there and be amongst the real deal!! You can’t get snow in your face
and your hair blown back sitting at your computer!

‘Monsters in my Machina’ 
I
have this analogy that life and individual personalities hark back to when you
are a kid playing in the sandpit. Everyone really wants to be in the sandpit;
included, feeling part of the pack, the team and in confidence. There’s the kid
who’s the megalomaniac dominating all the toys, the kid building amazing crazy
things out of nothing…well sand; there is the kid who’s eating the sand or
putting their own poop in the toys, there is the kid who is terrified of
getting in and who just desperately want to be part of the fun but cant figure
out how…
As
we get older, we get bigger and more concerned with how others perceive us in
the sandpit, but the basics are the same. Everyone wants to be in the pack.
I
find solace in this funny image especially when encountering conflict- because
really it all comes down to fear and power. A lot of the time it’s not necessarily
about the ‘thing’ or the ‘problem’ its much bigger; sometimes it’s just about
wanting someone to ‘hear’ us and let us climb back into the sandpit.


‘Creative Heart’
You
have a different grasp on life when you have experienced a spectrum; I crave
variation and am fascinated by turning life’s curves into visual manifestations.
For me, life is about pushing the envelope a little further and redefining my limits.Overcoming
adversity erases the rationality away from turning your whole world upside
down. Not to say that this process has not been absolutely terrifying at stages!
- Second guessing and reflection, re-evaluation and brain storming conversations
with friends makes what you’re trying to achieve relevant, on track and fun!                                                                      '180 km/hr Monarch Butterfly'MISSION: I
am travelling to Japan and beyond to soak up as much inspiration, art, culture,
music, and snow missions as one person can put in a trip! While away, I aim to make connections with like-minded artists.
Using the adventure, and my passion for snowboarding and the outdoors to meet
people and make real rather than virtual connections, I hope to encounter and
create opportunities for myself to exhibit in Japan, and find Japanese artists
who are interested in exhibiting with me.
The
trip will be inspiration for my next body of work.
Long-term I
will explore turning this into a biennial event, alternating between NZ and
Japan.
AIM: To travel with wanderlust. It has been a dream of mine to exhibit my
art in Japan- I want to share my passion with others and create something
bigger than myself.
OBJECTIVE: To
encourage other people to get out there, take risks to follow their dreams,
live a healthy lifestyle and to spread the love and laughter. By sharing my
enthusiasm for life & enthusiasm for snow and adventure I hope to encourage
others to truly follow their passions.
WHO BENEFITS?: Myself
and associated project supporters, friends, and artists are the immediate
beneficiaries, both in Wellington and overseas. This network will grow and
expand through this project; initially with exposure through indiegogo.com,
then through the trip to Japan, Europe and following on to the exhibition post
adventure. The quantifiable amount of people associated is going to snowball!

INTENDED AUDIENCE: Anyone
interested in art, visual culture, adventure, travel, Japan/ NZ..living life
BIG
HOW DOES THIS PROJECT RAISE AWARENESS
OF JAPAN/ NZ/ ART?: This
project raises awareness in visual culture by linking creative artists in
different countries, creating opportunities for cultural exchange and
development.
‘Sometimes the Day is Just Two Sizes Too Small’ -  Guash, watercolor,
mixed media


What’s your background Miss Moena?
My Art and Design background is Industrial and
Textile Design. I work in a mesh of industrial materials and embellished
application. 
I enjoy juxtaposing mediums and techniques. My
illustration & topographic style is dense, detailed and almost cartographic
in nature. Themes & subjects drawing inspiration from Japan, popular culture,
my environment and experiences.
My process is playful and dynamic. Sketching,
collating, modeling and digital rendering moves through to tighter finished and
polished graphic design, painting, bronze sculpture and etched glasswork.
    ‘Keep Your Head in the Clouds’                  Moxham ‘Disappearing Line’ Exhibition
I embrace change, improvise & adapt, I expand
on my skills by working with new people in exciting environments- this trip is
the next step in my journey as a person and as an artist.
I seek the freedom and responsibility to create and
grow within a culture that values teamwork, creativity, best practice,
integrity and innovation. I am focused on excellence and dedicated to seeking
out new, challenging experiences. By making this trip to Japan I am fulfilling
a lifelong dream while making something bigger than myself- an opportunity for
other artists to share, grow and develop by participating in my adventure.
“Those who
danced were thought to be quite insane by those who could not hear the
music" ANON
                       ‘Suspension’ 

Japan and Moena…

I
have been crazy about all things Japanese since I can remember.  My Grandmothers collected Japanese
artifacts, art, netsuke (small bone carvings) and furniture, and my Mother, Grandmother
and her Mother loved all things Oriental. I studied Japanese at school and
continued classes after university- I have a Bachelor of Design (Honors)-
Textiles with 3 completed years of Industrial Design; my projects and work
paying homage to Japanese aesthetics and practices.
I
cook Japanese cuisine, am inspired, influenced and intrigued by historical and
modern Japanese art, literature, culture & design and even went through the
relevant ‘Hello Kitty’ stage! & then there is the snow!!......
I
am tattooed with my own artwork, which is influenced by Japanese woodcuts.
Although,
none of this compares to really experiencing a culture first hand.                  

           ‘Vulture Kisses’- digital, screen-printed and embroidered textile
project.
Alongside
everything arty & Japanese, I am passionate about motorbikes &
snowboarding. Both are sports with a high level of camaraderie and attract a
like-minded set of individuals who live life to the fullest, are go getting
adventurers. When motorbiking at speed, to make smooth tight turns, you want to
be rolling lightly on the accelerator with your eyes at the horizon’s vanishing
point, not anywhere near the brake or looking down… creative projects seem to
benefit in the same way.
Geographically New Zealand and
Japan are very similar- and both have an ardent crew of snow mad powder dogs,
who travel seasonally between both countries. 
This love of snow binds us with
a common tie (or rope tow as the case may be)- it’s a perfect way to meet
people on the same wavelength.


Goals and intentions?

This adventure is the fulfillment of a
personal dream- but hopefully the beginning of something bigger as well. I am
sealing everything up in New Zealand to leave unhindered by ties, commitments
or schedule concerns- I am off with wanderlust and going where my heart
dictates.
Travelling for me is about sharing,
connecting, inspiring, being motivated, networking, creating, supporting and
living. Its up, down, in-between, and all types of sideways- and its FRESH!
While travelling, I will be researching
different artistic techniques- developing my knowledge of sculpture, glasswork
and illustration in particular, while accumulating experiences with people of a
similar creative orientation.

Measure of success:



Goal


Performance Measure




Funding raised from
  indiegogo towards travel expenses in Japan and Europe


Target reached and
  itinerary booked





To meet other artists
  around the globe


Postings on my blog of
  events attended, places visited and experiences had. 
Compiled email/ contact
  list




To make new interesting
  and informed art from my experiences


New bronze/ glass/
  illustrative/ mixed media works




Group art show post trip


Artist group exhibition




Connections with creative
  industries, galleries and events in Japan 


Moena Moxham artwork
  exhibited in Japan.


 Building Relationships
Face-to-face:

Communication in the modern
world is becoming increasingly digital, through technology, media, social
networks and profiles. We have less ‘genuine’ contact and are becoming more dependent
on using these media outlets to make friendships or business connections.
  
                                                Skydiving Wairarapa, New Zealand
I like the good ol’ fashioned
technique of meeting face to face! You engage on a direct, human and genuine
plane; leave room for happy coincidence, change of plans, hiccups and an
organic development of meeting others through experiences and participation.
Rather than being behind a computer screen, cushioned by a screened &
edited digital representation of yourself.

 

                          My favorite place in NZ- Lake Ohau,
Twizel, South Island
A year ago my good friend Jonny
shared a story about an Ant and a sugar cube, which has given me much joy in
remembering and helped me when I think I have lost track…
Miss Ant was going about her
business when low and behold a Giant cube of sugar dropped in her track.
‘Bloody hell!’ exclaimed Ant “What am I to do? This thing has blocked my
path!!”. Miss Ant was fond of sugar and so she thought “Ok, fastest way, and
tastiest is for me to munch straight through!”, so off she started, little
nibble, by little nibble going straight through the center… but this process
was slow, and she became full fast, and she was lonely- no-one else there to
help her, she had burrowed into the dark alone. With only her thoughts as
company and no track of time in the dark, she stopped. This path was not
working; it didn’t feel good. Yes, it may be the fastest way through, she
thought, but its no fun at all! Out she backed from the tunnel
and re grouped her thoughts. It would be longer going around the cube but she
had tried option one, so no harm in trying option two! Off she embarked. She felt good
in the sun, encountering different things along her route around the perimeter.
She could stop and nibble off the side of the cube when she needed, and as she
progressed she met other ants. They shared their stories and
experiences, laughed and took time out to hear each other’s point of view. As she came around to her original
path, she reflected on her adventure. What had seemed like a problem had
instigated so many other interesting circumstances. How she had grown and
learnt from the new situations she had undertaken! Keep your eye on the prize,
change your mind, try new tactics and have fun along the way and more often
than not, what you think might be a roadblock, turns into an enriching
diversion.
There is no right or wrong
route- whatever convoluted way it takes you!




                                                                            ‘Meld’ 
Media networks do have their
uses- especially when it comes to connecting people internationally; and I
believe this project can benefit from both traditional face-to-face
communication, and digital.
Skype is a terrific tool for
video calling. Artists invited to exhibit may not be able to afford to be at
the show in person, but could be invited to participate in ‘real time’ through
video stations set up at the show, allowing them to interact in real-time. 
Regular updates on my travels
will occur, using my BLOG rather than social media to keep everyone up to date with how
the project is progressing.




                                         Whakapapa, Mt Ruapehu, New Zealand




                                                                 ‘Dei Ex
Machina’


Pitch in! Why should I help you
fundraise?
Using indiegogo.com appealed to me because of
the ‘perk’ based funding. I like trading! Indiegogo.com lets me sell my art to
raise money towards a goal, while spreading the word internationally about my
idea.
Attitude is everything. With a smile,
good ideas and planning, excellent execution, lots of laughter, some cachinga
and a little luck- this project is gunna fly!
This is not just about funding: Indiegogo is an international platform, with people worldwide. 
If you are in Japan, or Europe and know someone might be interested in
this project- please link them in- I would love to get connected! 





                  Queen Charlotte Sound, Malborough, South
Island, New Zealand






                  Summit of Mt Kaukau, Wellington, New
Zealand, September 2014


What your $$ are helping purchase:
Financial
support of this project is rewarded with artistic perks- listed to the right. 
There
is $62,550 worth of art made and
ready to send -photos of the artworks for purchase is through the project above.
I
have done some fantastic commission works and am always up for a project- if
you don’t see something here you like; I can make something tailored
specifically to you.
The
current Itinerary is to leave New Zealand in late January 2015
Itinerary
Japan is Tokyo, Osaka, Kyoto, Nagano, Hakuba, and Naoshima (Art Island).
Depending
on how much is raised- I will be extending the trip and stops to meet with
people in & around Japan can be added… 
AND
then on to London (poss via India) and backpacking Europe. 
London,
Berlin, Reykjavik, St Petersburg, Brussels, Lisbon, Monaco, Budapest,
Barcelona, Santorini…
Below are two budgets for 30
days Japan and 60 Europe. I aim to extend both of these.
                              
                              



Donate $0 and still be part of the project!

You! Yes- YOU indiegogo site viewer can be a part of this adventure without donating a cent. By sharing this page; sending it to family, friends, colleagues
and posting/ linking it on your Facebook. Help me spread the word- by doing
this you are involved in the best way possible.
By sharing my project you are supporting in a way far more important
than money.

               
‘THNX’ – Printed and embossed Moena Moxham
‘Thank You’ postcards






Project Supporters & the THANK YOU section!


It takes so many more hands than just
one set to make a successful project take flight.
This section is dedicated to the
phenomenal people and organizations that have helped me along the way. 



Mum, Dad, Nana, Gibby, Anna Campion, Suzie
Fitzgerald, Paul McArthur, Maree Turner, Gene de Marco, Julie Nevett, Jonny
McKenzie, Tarryn & Mike Wilton, Workshop, India Heath, Joshua Ye, Benny Ramsay, Claartje ten Berge, Tamara Kogler, Stephanie
and Martin Bell, Sean Aicken, Timon Wilkinson, Artrix
Glass Studio, Becca, Blake Dunlop, PXLX, Nic Larsen, Linda Sue, Alex Hsieh, Ria & Tom, Linda Chimm,  Takas, The Hangar, Anna Jamieson, Luit & Jan Beiringa, Kris Tyrer, Wellington Print Finishers, Jonathan Campbell, Birgit Krippner, Grant Franklin, Lyndsay Patterson, Watermark Signs, James Davison Motors, Motorad, Steph Lusted, Pip O'Brien, Aro Video, The  Frame Shop/ Walrus Gallery, Llisa & Josie Keating, Maree Jepherson- Soup, and to all the friends and peeps along the way!

story:
My name is Will Hutnick and I am an artist living and working in Brooklyn.  I graduated from Providence College in 2007 and got my M.F.A. at Pratt Institute in 2011.  I play the cello in the Brooklyn Symphony Orchestra, and I'm usually covered in paint.


This past year, my work and I have travelled all over the NYC metro area, including:

  • a summer residency on Governors Island, where I created an installation, "Atlas", composed of strips of tape directly on the wall;
  • to Bushwick and Crown Heights, where I curated the exhibitions "Future Folk: Part 1 & 2" at Brooklyn Fire Proof and LaunchPad with Polly Shindler;
  • to Chelsea, where I transformed a pop-gallery via Uprise Art into my studio for two weeks;
  • back to Bushwick, where I opened my studio to the public for Bushwick Open Studios;
  • and even to Bedminster, NJ, where I exhibited my work in a solo show, "He Chutes He Scores", at The Center for Contemporary Art.

It's been a busy year already, and I'm not done yet.


I am excited to head to Johnson, Vermont, this October to immerse myself in my work and practice and make a huge mess at Vermont Studio Center.  I will have four weeks to just paint and draw and create.  I will have the opportunity to experiment and expand my vocabulary; to meet and inspire new artists that share a similar drive and passion; to reflect and find new meanings and new directions in my work; to grow and take risks.



With your generous support, I will be able to create work in an environment where my only job is to create work.  I am defraying some of the costs of the program with an artist's grant and work exchange, but it is expensive for an artist who is usually slinging cocktails a few nights a week to get by.  In exchange for your help, I will give you stickers and original art.  Win Win WIN.


Your support will enable me to fully realize all that this residency has to offer.  As my Mom would say, this is the "GIFT OF TIME"; it's a fantastic opportunity to challenge myself and guide my work to the next level, whatever that might be.


Thank you for your help - I look forward to sharing my work and progress with you!

LEGAL: Branco, Gen Duarte, Nick Alive, TIKKA, Vermelho 

Gallery 102 at The George Washington University introduces five Brazilian street artists to the US capital! 

  • The five artists presented in this exhibition are among the most talented and interesting street artists working in San Paulo today. The curators of "LEGAL" believe they deserve recognition outside Brazil. 
  • Artworks by these artists provide insight into the personal lives and emotions of San Paulo communities, and remind American observers of the potential benefits and communal power of street art. 

Exhibition Budget: $5000 

  • The exhibition budget includes the cost to print and publish professional-quality catalogs, exhibition posters, invitations, and other press materials, in addition to the cost of programming events. 
  • The largest cost of the exhibition is transporting the artworks from Brazil to Washington, DC, and then insuring and paying import taxes. 
  • Supporters will have the opportunity to select a variety of perks, from signed limited edition posters, to a dinner with the curators and a street art in tour in Washington, DC, depending on donation level. 

The Impact

  • This exhibition will help strengthen ties between Washington DC visitors and the artists' home communities in San Paulo. 
  • Additional programming surrounding the exhibition, like lectures, video screenings, and workshops will bring together the Brazilian community in DC, specifically within an arts context. 
  • This exhibition also has the potential to shed a more positive light on the benefits of community building through street art. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Tell your friends about "LEGAL," post to Facebook and other social media. 
  • Sponsors interested in helping contribute in other ways are encouraged to contact curator Roxanne Goldberg at roxie_goldberg@yahoo.com

story:
Introduction

My name is Mynzah and in November of 2008 I experienced a spontaneous Kundalini awakening.  I have utilized this gift of Grace to express in various ways our collective union of one, as well as our Divine connection with the all the Universe and that which is seen and unseen.

Following the Kundalini awakening, one of the ways that I have expressed the Divine truth has been through digital art.  I have recently been presented an opportunity to display my art in a gallery in Arizona.  This will be the first time that my art has be in a gallery and I am honored for this opportunity.

For many years I gave my art away until several people approached me about my art being available for sale in a gallery.  At the time, I wasn’t comfortable selling my art, not because I didn’t feel it was good enough but because I wanted everyone to have access to it regardless of their social economic status, and I still feel this way.  One day while in meditation, I received guidance that it was now appropriate for me to make my art available for purchase. I resisted but eventually became aware that a reciprocal exchange of energy was necessary and healthy for all involved.

In 2010, I opened a venue for my art through Fine Art America, yet didn’t upload any of my art until 2011.  It wasn’t until the beginning of 2012 that I actually made my uploaded art available for purchase.  Now, I have an opportunity to present my art in an art gallery.

Why Indiegogo?

I am utilizing this platform (indiegogo), to raise the money necessary to establish my art in this gallery and potentially in other galleries both locally and abroad.  To present my art to the public in a gallery format requires that I print and frame my art.   This is different for me because through Fine Art America, printing and framing are done for me at the time of each purchase through them.  Therefore, I must purchase my prints and framing, this is one reason I have come here for assistance with making my art available for public display in a gallery.

Goals for this show

My goal for displaying my art in this gallery is to reach as many as possible that ordinarily would not view my art online.  My intention is to establish my art locally and then abroad in the physical.

The purchasing of my art assists me in recouping my costs and allows me to re-invest in my creative expression and to provide more to the public.

I’m not a formally trained artist and my motivation for making art is not money.  I make art to assist in the awakening of the collective consciousness and also because I enjoy it very much and others appreciate it as well.  Placing my art in a gallery is a very big step for me and one that I have shunned for some time but have now come to a place of acceptance.  I now see the benefits for all by having my art available for display in the physical rather than merely online. 

To view my art online is one thing but to see it in the physical is entirely different experience.  I came to this realization the first time I printed and framed my first art piece and witnessed the extremes for myself.  Printed and framed, my art took on an entirely different dynamic for me and others.  This is the reason for the importance to present my art in the physical to the public.  True appreciation of the art I create comes from viewing it in physical form, therefore I am reaching out to manifest it into the physical reality with your assistance and this show.

Costs

All money raised through Indiegogo goes towards the costs of the show below:

  • Prints of Art for show
  • Framing of Art
  • Crating and shipping the work
  • Insurance
  • Transportation
  • Accommodations
  • Labeling
  • Studio supplies (lamination, materials, paper, ink etc)
  • Advertisement

Since I’m setting up my own show and managing it, this is entirely different than if I were just sending the work to a gallery. A gallery would normally take care of the logistics, taxes, venue, sales, PR and business development. However, in my case, the entire cost is my responsiblity.

PERKS!

From a signed greeting card to an exclusive personalized piece, there is a perk for all level of supporters!

$10 - Signed Greeting Card  
Signed greeting card of one of the pieces from my upcoming show "Awakening", with a personal message of thanks for supporting my work!

$25  - Signed Archival Print 8 x 8
A signed high quality print of your choice, of a portrait from my upcoming show "Awakening".  Archival print on fine art paper, 8" x 8"

$50  - Signed Archival Print 14 x 14
A signed high quality print of your choice, of a portrait from my upcoming show "Awakening".  Archival print on fine art paper, 14" x 14"

$100  - Two Signed Archival Prints
Two signed high quality prints of your choice, of two portraits from my upcoming show "Awakening". Archival print on fine art paper, 20" x 20"

$150  - Full Size Signed Print
Full-size signed high quality print of your choice, of a portrait from my upcoming show "Awakening". Archival print on fine art paper, 36" x 36"

$200  - Two Full Size Signed Prints
A set of two full-size signed high quality prints of your choice, of two portraits from my upcoming show "Awakening".  Archival print on fine art paper, 36" x 36"

$3000 - Exclusive Personalized Full Size Print
I will create a 36" x 36" art piece exclusively for the individual...on canvas and framed.  No other prints of this exclusive work will be created by me and the individual will possess sole rights of the art. 

Summary

Thank you for considering supporting my first gallery art show.  If you are unable to donate monetarily, I would greatly appreciate if you could share this campaign with friends on social media or by word of mouth…every little bit helps and I am grateful for your support.  Should you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.

Thank you again for your consideration.

Blessings and Love to You and to All that You know.

~ Mynzah
story_txt:
Introduction
My name is Mynzah and in November of 2008 I experienced a spontaneous Kundalini awakening.  I have utilized this gift of Grace to express in various ways our collective union of one, as well as our Divine connection with the all the Universe and that which is seen and unseen.
Following the Kundalini awakening, one of the ways that I have expressed the Divine truth has been through digital art.  I have recently been presented an opportunity to display my art in a gallery in Arizona.  This will be the first time that my art has be in a gallery and I am honored for this opportunity.
For many years I gave my art away until several people approached me about my art being available for sale in a gallery.  At the time, I wasn’t comfortable selling my art, not because I didn’t feel it was good enough but because I wanted everyone to have access to it regardless of their social economic status, and I still feel this way.  One day while in meditation, I received guidance that it was now appropriate for me to make my art available for purchase. I resisted but eventually became aware that a reciprocal exchange of energy was necessary and healthy for all involved.
In 2010, I opened a venue for my art through Fine Art America, yet didn’t upload any of my art until 2011.  It wasn’t until the beginning of 2012 that I actually made my uploaded art available for purchase.  Now, I have an opportunity to present my art in an art gallery.
Why Indiegogo?
I am utilizing this platform (indiegogo), to raise the money necessary to establish my art in this gallery and potentially in other galleries both locally and abroad.  To present my art to the public in a gallery format requires that I print and frame my art.   This is different for me because through Fine Art America, printing and framing are done for me at the time of each purchase through them.  Therefore, I must purchase my prints and framing, this is one reason I have come here for assistance with making my art available for public display in a gallery.
Goals for this show
My goal for displaying my art in this gallery is to reach as many as possible that ordinarily would not view my art online.  My intention is to establish my art locally and then abroad in the physical.

Prints of Art for show
Framing of Art
Crating and shipping the work
Insurance
Transportation
Accommodations
Labeling
Studio supplies (lamination, materials, paper, ink etc)
Advertisement

Since I’m setting up my own show and managing it, this is entirely different than if I were just sending the work to a gallery. A gallery would normally take care of the logistics, taxes, venue, sales, PR and business development. However, in my case, the entire cost is my responsiblity.

$200  - Two Full Size Signed PrintsA set of two full-size signed high quality prints of your choice, of two portraits from my upcoming show "Awakening".  Archival print on fine art paper, 36" x 36"

Thank you again for your consideration.
Blessings and Love to You and to All that You know.
~ Mynzah

story:
ART AS A NOVEL

I am not a household name, except among some select households of national and international art collectors in the know. What they know is that I am a career committed professional visual artist who for the past fifty years has continued to evolve.  My sculptures are making their debut in public places and will introduce many more people to my ever-expanding body of work. But the readers of this page will get to know my creative mind from a different perspective as contributors to my first novel.

The book portrays the life of a fictional female contemporary artist living and working in New York City.  Set against a global backdrop of haute couture, the story is a mystery that includes elements of romance, sex, greed, and murderous mayhem among the elite that collect and treasure art masterpieces, usually by buying and selling, but ultimately by whatever means necessary.  Skullduggery, betrayal, and unconditional love result, and create a powerful tale that is a perfect case of art mimicking life.

My maturity as a painter and sculptor has developed through observation.  It is this same observation that is needed to spin the captivating tale of the real life drama in the art world. Now, I am raising funds to pay the costs of completing the manuscript for my latest creation, art as a novel. This is a visual concept morphing into the written word. 

My goal is to raise $50,000. By contributing to this project, you will contribute to the creative process that ultimately renders the passion of art, the business of art, and yes, art imagery, in the form of a book. Words and images excerpted from the novel will be used as themes in future gallery and museum exhibitions and in book readings that transform concept into performance.

I consider community involvement to be a key element in my work. Especially in public art, collaboration and input help me to create the kind of work that people relate to and enjoy the most. I am currently working on a giant, landmark sculpture that will be exhibited in suburban Miami, Florida, and it has already generated excitement and anticipation in the community because the community is intimately involved in the creative process.

My novel is in many ways a work of public art. It is an art concept rendered as a novel. Your collaborative contributions will help me to produce the best, most enjoyable art novel I can.

Be my patron and join me in this exciting new effort.  ART AS A NOVEL REPRESENTS COLLECTIVE IMAGINATION!   LET'S GET STARTED!  MAKE SOME NOISE AND REMEMBER TO USE THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS!  If you cannot contribute funds, please contribute energy by spreading the word on all your social networks!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Funding goal: $50,000

Contributions requested:  $25, $1000…see the perks.

These funds will be used to pay for all the expenses of creating a manuscript, editing, designing the art and publishing a 350-page book.

If the goal is not met, the campaign will be renewed in a second round and funds raised will be “rolled over”.  All proceeds will be used on this project until the novel becomes a reality.

story:
• Who are we?

elgalpon.espacio

We are a self-managed project that consist of a collective of artists from different fields working around the production and dissemination of artistic research and experimentation in contemporary art practices.


We have been working for five years in the district of Pueblo Libre, which is outside the established art scene in the city of Lima. From here we call on local, regional and international artists to develop their projects in our space.

 

• What are we trying to raise money for?

We are seeking funds to develop the Second National Festival of Performance of Lima, this festival is an exchange platform where artists, theorists and citizens share their experiences and points of view about the practice of performance or action art. We seek to help strengthen and recognize the paths already undertaken by many artists and action art collectives in Peru. Also, our intention is to bring the general public to experience these forms of contemporary art productions.


The Festival will consist of teaching laboratories, lectures and exhibitions of performance for 18 days (11 days in Lima and 7 days in the city of Arequipa).


This year will extend the Festival to the city of Arequipa, known as the white city. Arequipa is one of the major cities of the southern highlands of Peru, with a great artistic tradition and culture where artists lately are developing and strengthening multidisciplinary art initiatives. We want to fly a group of four artists and cultural managers of Lima to develop and lead the activities of the Festival in this city.


In addition, we want to fund the mobility of three (3) artists within various regions of the country to the capital (Lima), to participate in the Festival so they can enrich their local artistic practice.


• When will our project take place?

From 09 to 26 November 2012 in two cities of Peru.


• Where will our project take place?

They take place in Lima from 09 to 17 November and the city of Arequipa from 19 to 26 November 2012.


• The impact of our project and the people who will benefit from it.

The majority of activities and initiatives in relation to contemporary art practices are concentrated in the capital, Lima, generating an inequality of opportunity in terms of information and dissemination of the proposals from the creators.

We feel its necessary to break this centralism and link up with these projects that already exist while generating new audiences. The arts and its multiple expressions are a civil right and should not stay within small and elite circuits.

The beneficiaries would be not only the artistic sector, but the general public.

 

Project Associate

We have had the support of the Centro Cultural de España in Lima for both the First Performance Art Festival and the current Second Performance Art Festival. However, the funding we receive is insufficient to develop this project and to make it grow. This is why we have decided to pursue our goals through this medium.

 

 

EN ESPAÑOL

 

• ¿Quienes somos?

elgalpon.espacio

Somos un proyecto autogestionario conformado por artistas y creadores de diversas áreas que trabaja en torno a la producción y difusión de propuestas artísticas de investigación y experimentación en prácticas de arte contemporáneo.

Venimos trabajando desde hace cinco años en el distrito de Pueblo Libre, que esta fuera del circuito artístico establecido de la ciudad de Lima, y convocamos a creadores locales y regionales, así como internacionales para que desarrollen sus proyectos en nuestro espacio.

 

• ¿Para que estamos intentando recaudar el dinero?

Estamos tratando de obtener fondos para desarrollar el II Encuentro Nacional de Performance de Lima, este encuentro es una plataforma de intercambio en la que artistas, teóricos y ciudadanos en general comparten sus experiencias y puntos de vista, en torno a la práctica de la performance o arte acción. Buscamos contribuir, fortalecer y reconocer los caminos ya iniciados por muchos creadores y colectivos de arte acción en el Perú. Así mismo, nuestra intención es acercar al público en general a experimentar estas formas de producción de arte contemporáneo.

En el encuentro realizaremos  laboratorios pedagógicos, charlas y exhibiciones de performance durante 18 días (11 días en la ciudad de Lima y 7 días en la ciudad de Arequipa)

Este año extenderemos el Encuentro a la ciudad de Arequipa, conocida como la ciudad blanca, Arequipa es una de las principales ciudades de la sierra sur del Perú, con una gran tradición artística y cultural, donde últimamente sus artistas están desarrollando y fortaleciendo iniciativas de arte multidisciplinario. Viajará un grupo de cuatro artistas y gestores culturales de Lima para poder desarrollar y llevar las actividades del Encuentro a esta ciudad.

Además,  queremos financiar la movilidad de tres (3) artistas del interior de las diversas regiones del  país a la capital (Lima), para que puedan participar del Encuentro y así puedan enriquecer su práctica artística local.


• ¿Cuándo se llevará a cabo el proyecto?

Del 09 al 26 de Noviembre del 2012 en dos ciudades del Peru.

• ¿Dónde se llevará a cabo el proyecto?

Se llevar a acabo en la ciudad  de Lima del 09 al 17 de Noviembre y en la ciudad de Arequipa del 19 al 26 de Noviembre del 2012.

 

• El impacto del proyecto y las personas que se beneficiarán de el.

La mayor parte de actividades e iniciativas en relación a prácticas de arte contemporáneo se concentran en la capital, generándose una desigualdad de oportunidades  en cuanto a la información y difusión de propuestas de los creadores. Sentimos necesario romper este centralismo y vincularnos con estos proyectos que si existen y al mismo tiempo generar nuevos públicos. El arte y sus múltiples expresiones son derechos ciudadanos y no debería quedarse en circuitos pequeños y elitistas. Los beneficiarios no solamente serian el sector artístico, sino el público en general.

 

• Socio del proyecto

Hemos contado con el financiamiento y apoyo del Centro Cultural de España en Lima, tanto para el Primer Encuentro de Performance, como para nuestro actual proyecto, el Segundo Encuentro de Performance. Sin embargo los fondos no son los suficientes para ampliar y seguir creciendo con este proyecto. Es por eso que decidimos utilizar este medio para alcanzar nuestros objtivos.

story:
Anchors Away Photography and Design is a completely new rebranding of our company, previously know as {all my lovin} Photography and {all my lovin} Digital Creations.

We decided to rebrand in order to represent ourselves more personally and better.

In order to effectively rebrand, new equipment and supplies are needed.

We want to be able to provide to our clients the best and most personalized photography and design experience that we can.

The funding of this project will go to equipment upgrades (a new camera body, a better flash and a couple other upgrades to equipment) and marketing and packaging supplies (such as business cards, thank you cards, and boxes, cd sleeves and other items needed for boutique packaging). 

Funding this project not only helps this new company launch but it also encourages other small businesses to take the leap to expand their businesses. 

Feel free donate out of the generosity of your heart or to take advantage of the discounts on sessions and products!

story:
We are free - A story about the origin of the Garinagu

About the book: "With the help of the wonderful bird Dunuru, the brothers and sisters Binah, Namulé, and Hethu meet Dah, an old herbalist from the tribe of the Garinagu, who lives in the middle of the jungle. Like magic they fly into the past and experience the history of their people originating from Africa."


The book is a collaborative effort as my mother Ingrid, also an artist and musician, wrote the text along with my brother Ibo. My father Pen and brother Beni assists me as well with the storyboard of the book. I did the illustrations and the design.


My motivation for the book is to inspire a new generation of Belizean youth to learn and connect with the rich heritage and journey of the Garinagu and also to introduce this culture to all the people in the world.


My inspiration for the illustrations was of course Belize itself. I was born in Belize, migrated to Germany in 1990 with my family. Growing up in Germany allowed me to see the contrast, the beauty, the uniqueness of Belize.
But I always had a connection to Belize: the paintings of my father, the art of my mother, our music (we have a family band playing Punta Rock), the food (we mostly cooked Rice & Beans, Hudut and had Johnny cakes and Powder buns and Cassava bread), pictures, books and of course our vacations in Belize.


The target audience are first of all children and of course adults (parents and teachers) who will read the book for the younger ones. It is very important to grow up with the knowledge of your own culture and introduce something new to the ones who don’t know about it. It´s also help to create an own identity (where I am from and who do I belong to and don’t be ashamed who you are). But I also see everybody reading this book, learning about a new culture.

We selfpublished this book in 2010 and now we would love to published a second edition to share this wonderful project.

The $2,600 needed will pay for:

  • $ 2,100 printing costs (hardcover, full color) for 1000 copies
  • $ 400 shipping to Belize

  • You don't have to donate if you are unable to - you can still be an ambassador!
  • Please help share our project with ALL your contacts!
  • If you would like to support us in other ways please get in touch!

Thank you very much for your support


For more information visit

www.malicayetano.com

www.cayetano.de

(Family photo © Tony Rath Photography / tonyrath.com)
story_txt:
We are free - A story about the origin of the Garinagu

About the book: "With
the help of the wonderful bird Dunuru, the brothers and sisters Binah, Namulé,
and Hethu meet Dah, an old herbalist from the tribe of the Garinagu, who lives
in the middle of the jungle. Like magic they fly into the past and experience
the history of their people originating from Africa."
The book is a collaborative effort as my mother Ingrid, also an artist 
and musician, wrote the text along with my brother Ibo. My father Pen 
and brother Beni assists me as well with the storyboard of the book. I 
did the illustrations and the design.My motivation for the book is to inspire a new generation of Belizean youth to learn and connect with the rich heritage and journey of the Garinagu and also to introduce this culture to all the people in the world.My inspiration for the illustrations was of course Belize itself. I was born in Belize, migrated to Germany in 1990 with my family. Growing up in Germany allowed me to see the contrast, the beauty, the uniqueness of Belize.But I always had a connection to Belize: the paintings of my father, the art of my mother, our music (we have a family band playing Punta Rock), the food (we mostly cooked Rice & Beans, Hudut and had Johnny cakes and Powder buns and Cassava bread), pictures, books and of course our vacations in Belize.The target audience are first of all children and of course adults (parents and teachers) who will read the book for the younger ones. It is very important to grow up with the knowledge of your own culture and introduce something new to the ones who don’t know about it. It´s also help to create an own identity (where I am from and who do I belong to and don’t be ashamed who you are). But I also see everybody reading this book, learning about a new culture.We selfpublished this book in 2010 and now we would love to published a second edition to share this wonderful project.
The
$2,600 needed will pay for:

$
     2,100 printing costs (hardcover, full color) for 1000 copies
$ 400
     shipping to Belize



You
     don't have to donate if you are unable to - you can still be an
     ambassador!
Please
     help share our project with ALL your contacts!
If
     you would like to support us in other ways please get in touch!

Thank you very much for your supportFor more information visitwww.malicayetano.com www.cayetano.de(Family photo © Tony Rath Photography / tonyrath.com)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Graham Fukuyama and I'm an aspiring illustrator and creator of the book, But There Are Still More Colors. The book follows the alien Goro, who lives on a planet with no color, as he searches within his solar system to find colors following a chance encounter with a meteorite that leaves a massive rainbow crater not far from his home.

What We Need & What You Get

At this point, the book is entirely finished and only needs to see printing. I would like to have a run of 500 books printed and sold. My goal is the amount I need to have the 500 books printed.

The Impact

This book is designed differently from any other children's book on the subject of color as far as I'm aware. It introduces color in an active way rather than passively. The book serves a secondary function as well. Goro's journey to find colors is designed to teach children to be proactive in making changes in their life and the world around them.

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough, I know. If you can't contribute monetarily don't worry! Please however, do share this campaign with your family and friends.

story:
Recording artist, jazz pianist and Knoxville resident BRIAN CLAY is spearheading a Visual Art and Music initiative called “The PIANO PROJECT of KNOXVILLE.” This project will invite the Knoxville community to engage with each other as they share their love of music and the visual arts. Decorated by local artists and community groups, pianos will be placed in public spaces, to create community engagement and opportunities for people to connect, using music and visual art as the common ground and catalyst.

It's a musical and visual art equivalent to social media – prompting some to actively engage, while others can enjoy the engagement as a spectator. This project invites people to make music together ... to enjoy art together ... and be in community together. Each piano will be a symbol and celebration of the arts in places where artwork and music may not usually be found.

After living in its public space, each piano/piece of art will be donated to a local school, nursing home, healthcare facility or community center – thereby creating another opportunity of interaction with a different segment of the Knoxville community.

 

Support is needed to find and acquire pianos, purchase art supplies, commission artists, lease art studio space for decorating, compensate moving companies to transport pianos, compensate tuners to keep pianos in playing condition during their 'public' life.

story:
Bonjour à tous, moi c'est Ryan, j'ai 18 ans, je suis étudiant en droit à tours, et je fais partie du comité d'organisation du Téléthon sur la commune de Fondettes.
Comme chaque année à Fondettes, de nombreuses manifestations et activités sont proposées le weekend du Téléthon afin de récupérer une somme d'argent qui est entièrement reversée au Téléthon.

Pour cette occasion si particulière, nous organisons pour la première fois un LOTO. Cependant, nous n'avons aucun fond d'investissement. Nous n'avons donc pas d'apport d'argent qui nous permettrait l'achat des lots que nous voulons proposer lors de ce LOTO. Nous nous sommes d'abord tourné vers la générosité des magasins et grandes enseignes qui, pour la majorité, n'ont pas répondu favorablement à nos demandes de lots.

Et c'est maintenant vers vous et vers votre générosité que nous nous tournons. En effet nous avons besoin de vous et des possibles dons que vous pourrez réaliser dans le but de nous aider à concrétiser le projet. 

Tout vos dons serviront à acheter de magnifiques lots qu'il sera possible de gagner lors de ce LOTO. Ainsi ces lots serviront à amener le maximum de personnes au LOTO et le bénéfice n'en sera que plus grand, et autant le bénéfice financier que le bénéfice morale puisque je vous le rappelle, tous l'argent récolté lors du LOTO sera reversé au Téléthon qui je le penses est une cause nationale à laquelle nous nous devons d'y prendre part. Et si jamais les dons dépassent nos espérances, le surplus sera évidemment reversé entièrement au Téléthon.

Voilà donc le défi que nous voulons relever, et il n'y a que vous qui puissiez nous aider à le relever. Et si vous ne pouvez pas faire de don, vous pouvez tous de même y contribuer en partageant cette information sur les réseaux sociaux, de part le bouche-à-oreille, à vos amis, votre famille, ....

Merci d'avance pour la générosité dont, j'en suis sûr, vous ferez preuve.

story:
A Magic Theater and Shop in New Albany IN located only 10 minutes from downtown Louisville KY

My name is Brent Braun, and for the last 20 years, I have been performing, creating, selling and working behind the scenes to create magic for some of the top magicians in the world. I've created magic that has been seen by millions on Americans Got Talent, Netflix, Penn & Teller Fool Us, and even created the trick that Richard Jones used to win Britain's Got Talent. 

I truly believe that magic has the ability to change and inspire people from young to old. I've been lucky enough to be able to travel the world and see the positive impact magic can have on people's lives.  Now I'm hoping to bring that magic to a small intimate space in New Albany, IN. Unlike the magic you see on TV, there are no fancy boxes and no TV edits. This is pure sleight of hand, live and up close.

The Story...

At the age of 22 I became a single father and was stuck in a job I hated, surrounded by people and things I knew would take me nowhere. Enter the Greater Louisville Magic Emporium; a small magic shop located in Jeffersonville, Indiana. I walked into that shop one day on my lunch hour and my life was changed. I saw something that was impossible and spent the next few days smiling every time I thought about it. I would quit my job less than a year later and go to work for that shop for $75 a week and become a full time student of magic. That shop changed the path of my life in a way that I can never explain. Its where I met my wife and where I sold Torched & Restored, the very first trick I ever created and sold to other magicians. Yes, this is the same trick the Richard Jones used to win Britain's Got Talent in 2016. I've gone on to work for one of the largest magic companies in the world and to have my magic performed by magicians around the globe.  

I tell you all of this so you can understand how important magic is to me and my family, and also to the world. I want to create a space were people can share an experience that doesn't involve tiny screens and being disconnected from others. I want to create a space that's small, intimate, and immersive. A place that can give people a chance to see that people care about them and know that they can belong. 

That's why I need your help. Putting this together won't be easy financially, but my family and I have taken the steps to downsize our lives and decrease our living expenses so we can make this happen. But even then, building out the theater is full of risk and hurdles. We are looking at around $30,000 to build out the space and create the shop. My family will be investing $20,000 but we are reaching out to magicians and to communities of New Albany, Southern Indiana, and Louisville, KY, asking for your support. 

With your help, we will not only be able to remodel the space and build the theater, but also have a space to teach students of magic both young and old about the benefits of the art of magic. When the theater isn't being used to host shows, we will use it as a rehearsal space and training center for local magicians and magic enthusiasts. 

We can't do it alone

As you can imagine, building a theater and gift shop is an expensive undertaking. We need seats, lighting, a sound system, curtains, a concession bar, paint and other remodeling needs. We need an additional $10,000 to build this space out and make this a venue worthy of the acts we are bringing to town. Anything over the $10.000 will be used as working capital to help keep the shop open and allow us to work with local magicians and performance artists to bring their show to a broader audience.  

We have some exciting perks lined up, starting with high fives and hugs for those that just want to share the love of magic; T-shirts, and advance VIP tickets, as well as full consulting packages for those professional magicians looking to have Brent take their show to the next level. 

​

The Impact

In today's world, connecting with people is more important than ever. Having a small intimate theater space where we can come to together to learn more about each other and experience the impossible is important. 

Having run live events for the past 5 years for the worlds largest magic company, I understand what it takes to create an experience that people will remember and appreciate. All of those events have been Five-Star rated for a reason and with your help, we can bring those experiences to a small theater and share them one person at a time. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest struggle this project faces is getting people out of the house and into the space to share this experience. We truly believe that with your help and positive words we can help people understand how incredible sharing live experiences can be.  

That's the other reason we started this campaign. We need you to come see a show, tell a friend, write a review; we need your high fives, hugs and help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute even $5, there are many other ways that you can still help! Help spread the word about our campaign to others, follow NewAlbanyMagic on Facebook or just attend a show!  We would love to have you be a part of our community! 

Additionally if you have any services, materials, or other in-kind donations in lieu of monetary contributions, please email us at brentbraunmagic at gmail.com to learn more!

story:
Shane Anderson artist residency In Thailand

  • Award winning national Artist www.shaneandersonart.com
  • Dreaming to travel globally and educate children
  • International expressions of Art with children


What We Need & What You Get

  • $700= residency program, $2000= flight, $1300= supplies, food and additional expenses.
  • Be a part of the experience by getting a letter of the experience and or a keepsake!
  • Funds are being raised in multiple ways so they will still be applied towards the program.

The Impact

  • Encourage global change and education of the arts 
  • Multiple finished projects with children, kicks program 2 years, 4 elementary school murals, 2 community interactive murals
  • Children in Thailand will experience Art and children in Minnesota will learn about the experience Shane had while inThailand.  They will experience an art project

Risks & Challenges

  • Funds
  • Fundraising in multiple forms and locations

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We understand if you cannot contribute financially, but you can still help us by spreading the word!  The person down the street might know the biggest influencer!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who are We?

One year ago, with little capital and dream in hand - with the trust of 27 talented artists, I opened the Equis Art Gallery. It started in one small back room in an artist’s collective that in less than two months expanded to two rooms. Given that there is very little space, no street signage, no windows or exhibit lighting, I am gratified by the number of people who have found the gallery and have said how impressed they are by the artwork. Since opening, I have been honored to have sold over 50 pieces of art, in person and online. www.equisart.com

If not now, When?

I am an artist and the owner of the Equis Art Gallery. This funding campaign is about Fulfilling a Dream and Paying it Forward.  It is about knowing that none of us can ever know how much time we have left, but that we must do what we can to live our time to the fullest. In February 2013 I was diagnosed with ovarian cancer. I lost 6 months of my life to surgery and chemotherapy treatments. There comes a time when we all say to ourselves, If not now, When? A year ago was my time and opening the Equis Art Gallery was my dream. I have been an artist, exhibit juror, International art competition director and community arts organization co-founder. I employed my 30 years of retail experience from shop girl to manager. Now, I am a gallery owner.

Why?

It is time to expand again
- To better showcase the amazing artwork I already represent,
- To add more artists and their work,
- To be more visible within the business district.

To do this, the Equis Art Gallery needs to move to a storefront retail space. This will increase the current rent of $250 per month to more than $650 per month. There will also be additional expenses for utilities and insurance. I would love to have monthly receptions and artist demos. I need to be able to advertise more directly in local media and publications aimed at collectors of this kind of artwork, as well as sustain the gallery through this time of transition. With this move, the expenses for the gallery will increase dramatically. The business just about broke even in its first year. It is time to take a leap of faith in the gallery's increased success.


How Much / Where the Funds will Go?

This campaign for $24,000 will cover
-The initial moving-in expenses of preparing the new gallery space such as paint, lighting, exhibition systems, wall building, etc. 
- A portion of the rent for the 1st year after the move
- Insurance
- Utilities
- Advertising/Marketing
 If, at the end of the 40 days our goal has not been met, we will stay in the current location and use the money raised to create a powerful advertising campaign that will broaden the gallery's virtual visibility and help to make a move possible next year.

The Heart of the Matter!
As important to me as fulfilling a personal dream, is the idea that by opening this gallery, I could in some way, Pay-It-Forward. That I could create a business that would support the two “communities” that stood by me when I needed help the most. 

I am honored to be able to showcase the work of the amazingly talented equine artists who have been part of my support network for years. I am proud to bring their work to new audiences, to provide them an outlet for increased sales and to do so while respecting their enormous talent and hard work. The work at the gallery is more than horse, more than sport, more than pretty and is not frequently visible in the greater art world because of that. The Equis Art Gallery gives pride of place to work that might be treated as an afterthought in another gallery. 

The small town community of Red Hook, New York rallied around my family during my cancer journey and literally fed our every need. By opening a “destination” business, I help to bring visitors to Red Hook who would not have come before. In this way I can share the passion that I feel for my whole community. I can't count the number of visitors who have come for the gallery and later contacted me to say how glad they were to find us. How much they loved discovering Red Hook.

Your contribution to this campaign will be a huge part of making the gallery's growth a success. Every dollar, every dime, will enable me, through the gallery, to give back to those who always, without reserve, give so much.

This gallery is a partnership between myself, the Artists, Collectors, the Community and now You! I passionately believe in the gallery being an economic success for the artists that I represent and an economic driver for Red Hook. I hope you see the exciting future that I do, and would like to be a part in the growth of the newest hidden treasure of the Hudson Valley. Contribute to our campaign, get some great thank you gifts and help us become more visible! Please share this campaign with everyone you know and THANK YOU! - Juliet

(click on the "Gallery tab" to take a video tour of the gallery in it's current location)

than sport, more than pretty and is not frequently visible in the greater art
world because of that. The Equis Art Gallery gives pride of place to work that might
be treated as an afterthought in another gallery. The
small town community of Red Hook, New York rallied around my family during my cancer journey and literally fed
our every need. By opening a “destination” business, I help to bring visitors
to Red Hook who would not have come before. In this way I can share the passion that I feel for my whole
community. I can't count the number of visitors
who have come for the gallery and later contacted me to say how glad they were
to find us. How much they loved discovering Red Hook. Your contribution to this campaign will be a huge
 part of making the gallery's growth a success. Every dollar, every 
dime, will enable me, through the gallery, to give back to those who always, without reserve, 
give so much. 
This gallery is a partnership between myself, the Artists, Collectors, the Community and now You! I passionately believe in the gallery being an economic success for the artists that I represent
and an economic driver for Red Hook. I hope you see the exciting
future that I do, and would like to be a part in the growth of the newest hidden treasure of
the Hudson Valley. Contribute to our campaign, get some great thank you gifts and help us become more visible! Please share this campaign with everyone you know and THANK YOU! - Juliet(click on the "Gallery tab" to take a video tour of the gallery in it's current location)

story:
Zombie Pinup Book Vol. 2
Hello everyone! I'm rob Sacchetto, inventor of the very fist Zombie Portrait service, and artist behind countless Undead Illustrations! I've been a professional illustrator for over 30 years, and my specific Zombie/Horror art career is currently in its 14th year!
This new campaign focuses on continuing the Zombie Pinup Girl concept, but this time, using REAL individuals who would like to be in the book, as Zombie Pinup Girls themselves!!
To my knowledge, this has never been done before, and it is really becoming a hot idea among fans of the genre!!
What contributors will help create is a fantastic volume of unique and diverse Zombie Pinup Art, never before seen, and add to the staggering visual database of many hundreds of Zombie Pinups, I've created for the 'Zombie Pinup Divas' Art Series!

The Goal.
The goal for this project is to assemble at least 40 individuals who want to be illustrated as Zombie Pinup Girls for the pages of the book, based on the photo they submit! One of the massive perks is the painted cover image! The funds requested, and raised go to the creation of each original piece of art, which the participant receives, the printing of the book itself, and the shipping of both the book, and the art to each individual!
Other perks will include signed copies of the book for individuals who haven't been 'Zombified' inside, and many other goodies, outlined in the perks section to the right of this page! Zombie Pinup Sticker Sheets, Random Zombie Pinup ORIGINAL art, many from here : http://zombieportraits.com/?s=pinup&submit= and much more, will make this campaign utterly astonishing, and incredibly unique in every way!

The bottom line is, that despite all of the backers in the world, I'll really need at least 40 participants to fill this volume, and make it worthwhile!! If you know anyone who might be interested in this incredibly unique opportunity to become immortalized as a Zombie Pinup Girl within these pages, and also receive their original art to cherish, please send them here, or give them the details! It would be a HUGE helping gesture, Thank you SO MUCH!

I'm so excited about this project, I can scarcely articulate it succinctly!! To give individuals the opportunity to be depicted as these fantasy/horror creatures through art, and then be added to another great volume, is just immense!! This is an art guy dream come true!! I hope you all share the excitement! LETS DO THIS THING!!!

story: 1

Isis Women Arts is a collective of woman-identified individuals present to empower, foster, and promote creative and artistic expression. We value creativity, diversity, community, openness, and awareness.

Isis is ready to head up its 6th Annual Festival!! We are on a mission to showcase great talent, art and workshops to local communities for free. Please support us to be part of the force by donating to our campaign! Your generosity will keep us moving forward.

story:
Summary

Meet the artist.

My name is Kyle (Just Kyle). I’m a visual artist living around Philadelphia, PA. I graduated from Ursinus College with Honors in Studio Art and a minor focus in Gender and Women’s Studies. I currently work at Art Research Enterprises creating large sculptures and I volunteer at Millersville University as part of their Emerging Artists in Residency Program. I have shown in several exhibitions, been interviewed for radio, and am going to be among those published in a coming issue of Proto humanities Journal. I have been very fortunate to have so many opportunities and the continuous support of many great mentors, professors, facilities, family, and friends. Now, I need help to realize my next goal, but not without paying back my support system. Art and gender studies are my passion and they have precipitated into a sculptural art series I call “To Deal.” It was the series that got me my Honors in college and it’s been growing steadily since. I need your help to realize its continued growth! 

The project.

“To Deal” is the project you would be supporting if you choose to donate or spread the word. It is a multi-media sculptural/installation series that has been in the works for at least 2 years. Its primary objective is to ignite conversations about gender identity through discussions of home, the body, menstruation, craft, materials, and tools. “To Deal” was created from intense personal conflict that I have always experienced in relation to my own body. Dysphoria and anxiety impact my every day life and relationships and I felt unable to even speak about it in the most private of settings. The art-making began as a way to healthily cope after a decade of coping in all the wrong ways. It began to bridge gaps in my personal relationships, made it possible to explain my situation, and make connections with people who both did and did not experience gender identity crisis. The ability of art to help myself cope; offer solace, comfort, and understanding to others; and be the ignition for enlightenment for others is the importance of this project to me and why I cannot let it cease.

Needs and Rewards

Project needs.

My funding needs are material based and my material needs list can be found on my artist website at kylejustkyle. If you cannot donate monetarily and would rather donate the specific item (like if you have an old hammer or trowel) contact me! I’m super into recycling materials and being cost-effective.

The perks.

My perks are what I make besides the “To Deal” series: tatting and drawing. To see what's up for grabs check out this page's gallery.

The tatting is all handmade by me with a tatting shuttle and thread (yep, that's it). I'll be offering my own original designs that range from single to multi-layered pieces. But what does that mean? Basically, all tatting is beautiful, but as the layer count increases, so does the visual complexity, time commitment, and worth of the piece. My tatting is not only original but award-winning. My celtic designs (multi-layered pieces) in particular. My larger designs can be used as coasters for your favorite mug, ornaments, and wall decor; medium can be bracelets or large bookmarks; smaller designs can be used for festive ornaments, hair accents, necklace pendents, keychain accents, bookmarks -- basically anything you want. They're quite the versatile perk!


My drawings are usually notebook paper dimensions or less, but don't let the size dismay you - they are a packed visual feast with my stream-of-consciousness style drawing. These will be images you will continue to revisit and discover anew.

If you know you want a specific print/drawing, let me know upon check out and I will do my best to accommodate the request! Otherwise it will be a random selection and a surprise! Check out the gallery for options.

These are some of the ready-to-go options for drawn perks; there will be more to come! Each print is signed and numbered.

All the perk levels include the perk of being included in my patron's list which means that I will mention your patronage on my website and in self-published publications. I am extremely grateful to my patrons! Thank you!
If you donate be sure to let me know your option choice, drawing preference, and/or color choices either upon check out in note to organizer or via email at kylepetersonstudio@yahoo.com.

Unmet needs. Oh no.

Even if I do not achieve the entire amount I will purchase enough materials to continue with whatever I do achieve (I am resourceful).

Yay!

The Impact

The world.

Transgender and other non-dominant identities are coming into the mainstream view in the US and there has been a lot of news circulating. But there’s still a massive cloud of ignorance and hate surrounding trans and other non-dominant identities within the US. We are still largely the victims/survivors of violence, bullying, and suicide. I don’t know what the best way to deal is for everyone, nor would I claim to, but I want to try to make space for us by putting my work out there to start those conversations. To claim that space. This is my way of broadening my audience to broaden our audiences.

Success so far.

This is already a wise project to invest in because of it's continuous success record. This project has already been awarded twice (with The Goldberg Award for sensitive interpretation of an artistic vision & first place in the Starter Kit Juried exhibition) as well as being the reason I graduated with Honors from Ursinus. This work has the potential for so much more to come, it just needs people to continue backing it.


Risks & Challenges

What could go wrong?

The risks are small and few. I already have space to work, mentorship, studio support, and the skills to succeed in making the work physically manifest; my biggest roadblock now is lack of funds. And you can help.

Alternative Help Options

Please, even if you cannot donate monetarily, consider donating materials that you have, or spreading the word! Every little bit will help!

THANK YOU, Wonderpals!

-Kyle (JustKyle)
