story:
Hello supporters, fans and friends! The time has come for me to share a more concrete and cohesive idea about what this business will be.

SO HERE IT IS :

I have seen quite a few photobooth set ups. After I hatched the idea for Art Cult, I actively sought out photobooth setups in order to further research my idea. Most of them are indoor photobooths that are one or a combination of the following:

-A teeny tiny old school photobooth that costs $5 for a double strip of 4-5 black and white images ( I love these, always will. )

-An indoor photobooth (like you’d see at a convention or a wedding) that has a fabric backdrop and many cheesy props to pose with that either prints a paper strip of images or has the option to download from the photobooth website after the event. I saw one recently at a wedding that printed photo strips with a sticker backing, so you could add the photos to the bride and groom’s memory book right on the spot.

 

-I also saw a guy running a pretty neat little photobooth out of the back of his VW van. It was really small, but he’d rigged good lighting and a “tropical beach” backdrop, and had a small machine inside his van that took the image and printed strips. The line for photos was long...he was killing it.

 

All of the above scenarios got me thinking about what I wanted Art Cult Photo Booth to be:

 

MOBILE: I want to create a photobooth on wheels. Ideally (and perhaps eventually) Art Cult will be in a short bed box van. To start, Art Cult will be in an extra tall towable trailer. Most of the funds raised on indiegogo will be going toward a very specific type of trailer that I have researched and decided will be the best option for my business, based on the dimensions, door types, and door locations. Why do I want to be mobile?

-Easy set up and clean up, no hauling all of my stuff in and out of venues.

-Creation of spectacle. A totally enclosed mobile photo booth rolling up on an event is sure to attract attention. Yes, I’ve researched the city laws regarding doing this and yes, I can do it.

 

UNIQUE: No tropical beach backdrops. No cheesy giant sunglasses or clown wigs, ya’ll. Sorry, not sorry. Art Cult is meant to bring back the weird to Portland. The stylized backdrops will not just be backdrops, but they will cover the back wall, side walls, floor and ceiling of the trailer. I have completely researched how I will do this, and I’ve verified that it will work with a professional carpenter. Imagine a photo booth you can climb into that’s filled with hundreds of teddy bears attached to the walls and ceiling...or sparkly rainbows covering all of the walls...or a custom paint job created by a local street artist collaborator? That is Art Cult.

Custom interiors will be available to customers if they have a certain theme they need portrayed. As a headdress maker, I will also make custom props.

In addition to this, I will be creating custom photobooth ops like you see at the fair: the big boards painted with fun characters with their faces cut out so that you can put your face through. I’ve always loved these. These will be available to rent for indoor events. I have already begun creating the first one.

 

LOW COST/SELF SERVICE:

Again, the trailer is the most substantially priced item I will need to purchase. I considered getting a photo strip printer, but then I thought better of it; and here’s why:

While the old school strip photos are nostalgic and fun, most people want to share their images on social media right away. Art Cult photo booth will allow the user to take their own photos with their camera or smartphone. Instead of getting only 4-5 images, they can take an unlimited amount of photos and video if they want, and post what they want right away. Instead of charging an admission cost that aims to cover the cost of printing, the admission cost will be paid to cover a specific amount of time. Photo booth users can pay a flat fee to take as many images as they want in a two minute period (two minutes is just hypothetical, but you get the idea). Eventually I may offer polaroids or a printing via a soon to be released product from Polaroid called Polaroid Pop (http://www.polaroid.com/pop). I may even offer other types of printing/downloading in the future. But for now, Art Cult will be the vessel by which people can take images with their own cameras and camera phones.

I have discussed how to rig the lighting inside Art Cult with my brother, who is very knowledgeable. I’ve also come up with ways to keep people within their time limits while in the booth. I also have a free, private and secure place to store the Art Cult photo booth trailer while it’s not in use. Hooray!

 

MORE YOU SHOULD KNOW:

At first, I will be operating Art Cult Photo Booth primarily as an art project and asking for donations only. This is so that I can work out all of the kinks before offering it to other paying customers. I want it to run smoothly.

From time to time I will also be setting up Art Cult photo booth at random events and donating a  portion of profits to local organizations that I support and believe in. This is part of my way of giving back to the community that supports me and my business.

Want to support Art Cult? Help me get it up and running!! Make a contribution via Indiegogo today. THANK YOU!

A totally enclosed mobile photo booth rolling up on an event is sure to attract attention. Yes, I’ve researched the city laws regarding doing this and yes, I can do it. UNIQUE: No tropical beach backdrops. No cheesy giant sunglasses or clown wigs, ya’ll. Sorry, not sorry. Art Cult is meant to bring back the weird to Portland. The stylized backdrops will not just be backdrops, but they will cover the back wall, side walls, floor and ceiling of the trailer. I have completely researched how I will do this, and I’ve verified that it will work with a professional carpenter. Imagine a photo booth you can climb into that’s filled with hundreds of teddy bears attached to the walls and ceiling...or sparkly rainbows covering all of the walls...or a custom paint job created by a local street artist collaborator? That is Art Cult.Custom interiors will be available to customers if they have a certain theme they need portrayed. As a headdress maker, I will also make custom props.In addition to this, I will be creating custom photobooth ops like you see at the fair: the big boards painted with fun characters with their faces cut out so that you can put your face through. I’ve always loved these. These will be available to rent for indoor events. I have already begun creating the first one. LOW COST/SELF SERVICE:Again, the trailer is the most substantially priced item I will need to purchase. I considered getting a photo strip printer, but then I thought better of it; and here’s why:While the old school strip photos are nostalgic and fun, most people want to share their images on social media right away. Art Cult photo booth will allow the user to take their own photos with their camera or smartphone. Instead of getting only 4-5 images, they can take an unlimited amount of photos and video if they want, and post what they want right away. Instead of charging an admission cost that aims to cover the cost of printing, the admission cost will be paid to cover a specific amount of time. Photo booth users can pay a flat fee to take as many images as they want in a two minute period (two minutes is just hypothetical, but you get the idea). Eventually I may offer polaroids or a printing via a soon to be released product from Polaroid called Polaroid Pop (http://www.polaroid.com/pop). I may even offer other types of printing/downloading in the future. But for now, Art Cult will be the vessel by which people can take images with their own cameras and camera phones.I have discussed how to rig the lighting inside Art Cult with my brother, who is very knowledgeable. I’ve also come up with ways to keep people within their time limits while in the booth. I also have a free, private and secure place to store the Art Cult photo booth trailer while it’s not in use. Hooray! MORE YOU SHOULD KNOW:At first, I will be operating Art Cult Photo Booth primarily as an art project and asking for donations only. This is so that I can work out all of the kinks before offering it to other paying customers. I want it to run smoothly.From time to time I will also be setting up Art Cult photo booth at random events and donating a  portion of profits to local organizations that I support and believe in. This is part of my way of giving back to the community that supports me and my business.Want to support Art Cult? Help me get it up and running!! Make a contribution via Indiegogo today. THANK YOU!

story:
Father's to I've to Father's

May 1 - May 15, 2016

(an opera delivered by SMS)

The rhythm and melody of the piece are created by the communal vibrating and ringing of phones.  The allegory is delivered inside the text as short messages, links, and media. 

Texts occur up to twice a day for the duration of the work. 


Your name creates the poem

The names of participants are embedded into the work using a Python-based algorithm, which become woven together to form abstract poems sung by the characters.  All of the participants become an essential material in the work, a mutually created embodiment of the otherwise invisible participants sharing a conceptual space.
The process for constructing the poems is based on the rhyming rules of Classical Chinese rhymed verse. 

How do I participate?

When you purchase a ticket, we will contact you for your name and phone number such that we may enter you into the work. On May 1st, the work begins and the texts will start to come. That's it!

Why Indiegogo? 

We are utilizing Indiegogo as a digital box office because it offers both a sense of transparency and a conversation around the commodification of art. This is not a fundraiser, this is a work of art that is conscious of its patronage.

In the press

VICE interview with Banrei and Claire Molek
Irish Times

Created by Banrei, produced by Claire Molek

Banrei is an international multimedia artist.  Read about him here.
Claire Molek is one of the leading arts curators in Chicago. Check her out here.
Python programming by Alan Jackson.


_____________________________________________________

(Sponsored by Slick Text)

story:
Hexayurt for Solidarity

Inspired by the theme of this year's Festival for Solidarity and Cooperative Economy, cooperation, and motivated by the refugee crisis in Greece, we, a group of architecture students, unMonastery people and other volunteers, decided to build together a hexayurt for the festival, experiment with designing its content, and make it part of the cooperative village.

What We Need & What You Get

We need altogether 500 euros: 

  • €350 for building materials, and 
  • €150 for furnishing.

We will fully document our process, and post them online, to make it easier for other people to build their own hexayurt. We will also publish our design ideas for 'content' - how to give a soul to the temporary shelter.

We hope we will get enough money to cover our material expenses at least. If it is not the case, we will just buy tape, and build one from recycled cardboard.

The Impact

The Alternative Festival of Solidarity and Cooperative Economy happens each year in October, here in Athens. This year they are building a cooperative village, where various groups and individuals will present their ideas and projects for the future of Education, Health, Food, Work, Housing, Technology and Economy. 

Inspired by the festival's theme of cooperation, and motivated by the refugee crisis in Greece, we decided to build an 8 foot tall hexayurt for the festival, and experiment with designing objects, traditions and rituals for the inside - the soul of the shelter. 

Hexayurts are zero waste, cheap and energy-efficient disaster relief shelters made from cheap building materials. Originally designed to address issues of housing for refugees, they are most often built as temporary structures for festivals like Burning Man. It seems useful to learn how to make one!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help us financially, maybe you can share your experience and give us advice on how to build a hexayurt! Or, if you are in Athens, come and visit the Festival in the Akadimias Platonos park, 16-18 October 2015.

story:
please email size type with info ateam301@riseup.net ALSO email your address or a PO BOX.

If your a distro and would like to sell we can make bulk orders.


OUR STORY

From the NC support site:
http://asheville11defense.com/?page_id=170


On May 1, 2010 eleven people were arrested and charged with nearly $20,000 worth of damage to store front and car windows in a tourist section of downtown Asheville. Picked at random the eleven were swept off sidewalks and into waiting police vehicles. They have become the targets of egregious attempts by the Asheville Police Department to show it maintains control.

What began as ten misdemeanor charges and $10,000 bail for each person, quickly ratcheted up to $65,000 bail with an additional three felonies added to every person. Each are facing over five years in jail; a higher penalty then often found in domestic violence cases.

In a clearly desperate act, the state is aggressively persecuting these eleven by charging them with every crime they can muster, demanding exorbitant bail and publicly slandering the defendants. With no evidence against them the presumption of innocence has been completely abandoned by the media and police.

Regardless of your personal critique of May 1st in downtown Asheville, the result is the same. Eleven people are being attacked by the state. Regardless of any slander coming from conservative and liberal mediums alike – the accused deserve our support. The state would categorize these people as criminally liable vandals, guilty before the first court date set. We know they are friends, comrades, family, lovers and members of many communities across the country.

By believing the rhetoric of the state of North Carolina, the Asheville Citizen Times, etc. you not only lend legitimacy to the systems wishing to imprison them, but you further diminish our ability to reveal solidarity with one another.


WHY YOU SHOULD CARE

if the NC arrestees are convicted in short, they are being convicted based on random assertion that they are anarchists. for more reading http://zinelibrary.info/five-myths-about-ashevi...


WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

The NC arrestees need a loads of money, if you want a shirt buy one for 10 - 15 dollars. we're giving all profits to the asheville 11

HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP

donate money to their pay pall.

feel free to email us at ateam301@riseup.net. send us 10 - 15 dollars per shirt and we'll send you a tshirt.

also for more awesome shirts please feel free to visit www.dreamcitythrifty.org

story:
Our Story


Rock & Roll Portraits is the first large project by Jackson Potts ii.  The concept is that Jackson will further develop his skills as a photographer by creating images for musicians, images that not only look interesting but have significance to that specific band or individual, and doing so by using a variety of techniques.  A public showing of his collection will be held at Catalina Coffee August 17th - October 2nd 2011.  He will need to photograph 8-12 artists to have a complete body of work.


The process will involve an interview, where Jackson will learn more about the band and find significant, unique qualities of the band to explore and then base his images on.  He will then present a few different concepts to the artists, and receive their feedback.  After he has finalized the concept, he will create  a lighting diagram so he can communicate to his assistants what his lighting needs are.  And finally, he will conduct the photo shoot. 


Gallery Opening

              August 20th 7-9  

                          through October 2nd

             Catalina 

                2201 Washington Ave

                  Houston, TX 77007

                      713.861.8448 


Please come to the opening, and to say hi and see all the images.


and the 

After Party

Warehouse LIVE
Saturday August 20th 8pm-12pm
through October 2nd
WAREHOUSE LIVE
813 St. Emanuel StreetHouston, TX 77003 [Map]

Bands 


Benjamin Wesley

Knifight
the Soldier Thread
the 71's
Sam Riggs Band
Cody Jasper
Sara Van Buskirk
Kuumba Freeque


The Impact

Rock & Roll Portraits, by Jackson Potts ii has partnered with Living Water International, our partnership will allow this event and project to become something bigger, clean drinking water to people that otherwise may not have access to clean water.  Any money made from this show, will be going to a project that Jackson will be doing for Living Water International.  next summer, Jackson, Dietrich, and Jack (dad) will be going to Africa for 45-60 days.  Jackson will be photographing his experience to put together a coffee table book to raise support and awareness and Rock & Roll portraits, will help get us there.

 

Why We Need $900 


$900 Prints and Frames

This is the cost for 8 images, to print and frame. During the process I will be going to a lab to better understand the printing process and to a professional framer so I can see how to pick frames and learn how to framing works.


Mom and Dad are “sponsoring” my other costs) 

I would like to thank my Family for covering all my other costs for this project.  I know a lot is going into this and I am grateful for my family and all the others that are helping make this happen


Promotions

Flyers $100, Posters $100, Stickers $100, T-shirts $200 (so we have some stuff to give away and get people to the show)


Reception

basic bites and drinks, so people feel welcome.


Travel

we have one 4 day trip to Austin; food, gas and one hotel.  Mom & Dad will cover that, along with all the other random expended along the way.


After Party

the bands are donating their talent and Warehouse Live is donating the venue.



Thank You Perks... 

If you choose to be a part of our team, we want you to know how much we appreciate it.  We have various gift levels available.  All products will be shipped after the opening or you can pick up at the opening on the 20th.

story:
What Is The Celebrate Detroit Youth Festival?

The Celebrate Detroit Youth Festival (CDY), is a community initiative dedicated to celebrating and uplifting the youth of Detroit.  This outdoor event will take place on August 2013 in Detroit, Michigan.

Teachers, parents and community leaders are encouraged to connect with children through a number of workshops throughout the day, activities, games and conversation.  This allows students to discover their interests, values and goals while giving them a platform to share these thoughts with others.

How Can You Help

When we set out to produce the Celebrate Detroit Youth Festival (CDY) our hearts were in the right place but unfortunately it can get costly.  We believe in this event but we need a little assistance. With your help we can get the following:

  • Carnival Games
  • Food
  • Live Entertainment
  • Books For Reading Circles
  • Arts & Crafts
  • Backpacks
  • Schools Supplies
  • & More!

What's In It For You

By donating to the Celebrate Detroit Youth Festival (CDY) you are sowing a much needed seed into youth of the City of Detroit. Not only will you receive a personal thank you from us but you will receive one of the following:

  • Thank You Card
  • Magnet
  • Coffee Mug
  • Poster
  • T-Shirt
  • Baseball Cap
  • Pillow
  • Thank You Plaque

Our Goals

The goal of the Celebrate Detroit Youth Festival (CDY) is to engage kids and their parents in relevant conversation, excite them with live performances and activities while introducing them to resources available in their communities as they get ready for the upcoming school year.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are a number of ways that you can promote the mission of the Celebrate Detroit Youth Festival (CDY):

  • Become a Volunteer
  • Donate Your Professional Services
  • Spread The Word

Thank you for taking time out of your day to read about our event.  Visit our website, www.celebratedetroityouth.com for more information.

story:
Each year, 80,000 people from around the globe gather in a dusty windswept Nevada desert to build a temporary city, collaborating on large-scale art and celebration for a week before burning a giant effigy in a ritual frenzy. Rooted in principles of self-expression, self-reliance and community effort, Burning Man has grown famous for stirring ordinary people (or not so ordinary) to shed their inhibitions and act on their dreams.

It is from this blank canvas that we shall finally BUILD!

We share a deep bond with Burning Man, Art and Music. All of which are very close to our hearts. We’re extremely excited and blessed to have this opportunity to be involved in something that is seamlessly combining all of these together, giving us all our moments to shine and grow. This year, we've come together as one and decided that it was our time to give back to the playa in a way that will make a mark on house music sound camps at Burning Man for many years to come.

We’ve applied and received placement for a sound camp at 10 o'clock and GDP. This is right in the heart of some of most amazing sound camps for house music at Burning Man. We know that we will deliver a great musical experience for all those on the Playa to come and enjoy.

CONCEPT AND DESIGN

We’re currently in the process of building a 32' tall pyramid that is 8'x8' at the base and sits on a 5’ tall stage and core foundation. We believe that this structure is a modern hybrid of a pyramid and an obelisk. The Pyramid has 28 6" horizontal slats on all four sides. These slats will be illuminated from the interior with bright color changing light via eight 10-watt diode quad-core LEDs. The exterior will be illuminated with 16 additional LED pars. The structure is made of aluminum, wood and polycarbonate.

The coolest thing about the Kazbah Pyramid is that it houses a DJ booth at the base. The DJs will interact with the crowd through a 3'x6' cut out of the “All Seeing Eye”. The Eye will be lined with an High Density LED light strip. There will also be a 30-watt laser running through the spine of the structure out the top reaching miles into the sky. This petrified ray of sun energy will tap into divine frequencies, and radiate energy to all those who surround it with love, light, and sound.

THE SOUND

Our sound engineer has 8 years of experience working on some of the biggest sound camps on the Playa (Distrikt, Opulent Temple, Disco Knights, Center Camp Café) as well as Black Rock Arts. We will have 50,000 watts and 100 amps in a flat wall of sound aimed at the crowd. We will be providing clean, high definition sound without of two 17’ speaker stacks on each side of the stage and a dozen 18” subs, as well as to 2 qsc-k12s as booth monitors in the pyramid. With the exception of the qsc booth monitors, all the speakers are EAW. The DJs table is being made from 3 slabs of concrete on a rubber matt to reduce vibration. On that table will be 4 CDJ-2000s and a DJM-900 for the professionals to play on. 

THE MUSIC

The style of music and energy one can expect at the Kazbah is cutting-edge, sophisticated, cerebral deep house, and melodic tech. The caliber of DJs we intend to bring will be only the best in the world. We will be throwing a daily sunset party starting in mid-afternoon and ending sometime between 10pm and midnight.

HELP US GIVE BACK

We just want to create an amazing vibe where people can come and enjoy the Pyramid, while listening to some incredible music on a super clean sound system.

We need funding to pay for the rental of the sound system and associated costs with running that sound: transport, fuel, generators, etc.

Help us make our dreams a reality for all those to enjoy at Burning Man 2013, and for years to come. We appreciate your support. Spread the word!  

 

 FUN VISUALS

With the exception of the qsc booth monitors, all the speakers are EAW. The DJs table is being made from 3 slabs of concrete on a rubber matt to reduce vibration. On that table will be 4 CDJ-2000s and a DJM-900 for the professionals to play on. 
THE MUSIC
The style of music and energy one can expect at the Kazbah is cutting-edge, sophisticated, cerebral deep house, and melodic tech. The caliber of DJs we intend to bring will be only the best in the world. We will be throwing a daily sunset party starting in mid-afternoon and ending sometime between 10pm and midnight.
HELP US GIVE BACK
We just want to create an amazing vibe where people can come and enjoy the Pyramid, while listening to some incredible music on a super clean sound system.
We need funding to pay for the rental of the sound system and associated costs with running that sound: transport, fuel, generators, etc.
Help us make our dreams a reality for all those to enjoy at Burning Man 2013, and for years to come. We appreciate your support. Spread the word!  
 
 FUN VISUALS

story:
What is the Soundsslike Project?

Are you aware of the characteristic sounds of the place that you live in? 

Are you aware that you are going to lose important values unless you protect them?

and they will become sole memories..

"Sounds you heard yesterday may not sound like the same today,
you may not hear them again tomorrow and they may be lost forever."

Soundsslike Project is a world-wide project which aims to protect sonic values of cultures. Soundsslike team explores cultural expressions and daily life traditions of cities and collect their sounds to create a detailed archive for the "Cultural Sounds of the World". Once we collect sounds from all over the world, we will design a travelling exhibition.

If you want to hear some examples, you can visit http://www.soundsslike.com, or follow soundsslike on instagram!! We have also facebook, twitter and vimeo.

We have already bought our sound recording equipments and started with the cities of Istanbul, Dusseldorf, Amsterdam and Vancouver thanks to academic funds. Now we are planning to collect and archive sounds from Australian cities in December 2014 by your contribution, hopefully. We have already started to explore daily traditions and culture of Australia and got in contact with related academicians.


Are you a hero?

Soundsslike is the first project to collect and archive urban sounds from all over the world and to protect them as World's Cultural Heritage. As we live in this world, it is our responsibility to protect sounds of our own cultures.

So, if you think like us, you are already a hero! Yet, we will appreciate your contribution. :) 


Who are we?

I'm Pınar Yelmi from Istanbul, Turkey. I studied Industrial Design (BSc) and Communication Design (MSc). Currently, I'm a PhD candidate in Design, Technology and Society department and my research area is urban sounds which I have been dealing for 4 years.

One of the team members will be with me during our trip to Australia for assisting me in sound recording and carrying the 1 ton weight equipments. :)


Where is your money going?

  • travel expenses (4000$ flights, trains, buses)
  • visa expenses and other unforeseen stuff (500$)
  • accomodation (2000$)
  • and we will need to eat something (1500$)


Risks & Challenges

We hope we won't have any, unless a kangaroo steals our equipments.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Suggest us your favourite sounds in Australia.
    • Become a part of the project simply by recording videos/sounds from your own cities and sending them to soundsslike@gmail.com. We will publish them in our website with your name.
    • Tell your friends about this project.. Let them know!
    • Share your apartment with us so we won't be asking money for accomodation. :)


    THANK YOU VERY MUCH!!

story:
Public Restrooms..

are a necessary evil. We've all used a public restroom at some point in our life and will most likely have to visit one again...soon. Every communal bathroom on the face of the planet has been humorously designed with embarrassingly awkward stall door gaps that are at minimum, as wide as the Grand Canyon.

 

Let me set the scene. You've checked every stall and found the cleanest of them all. You push the door open, hang your bag, pull down your bloomers, and prepare to either sit or squat. What happens next is short of utter and complete death: As soon as you think you can relax and let nature take its course, you make eye contact with a perfect stranger who decided that instead of checking for feet that they would simply peer in via the large gaping space in-between your stall door. Awwwkward! Now, maybe it was an innocent faux pas, or as I have surmised, these types just altogether refuse to be burdened by the boundaries of basic etiquette when using public spaces. Either way, who really has time to figure out the "why" when you are sitting in a stall, bottomless?

I have created a unique product that will put an end to those errant eyeballs and give you the added privacy that you need in order to put the "rest" back in restroom. Introducing Privy potty strips!

What makes Privy potty strips unique?

Flushable: Our strips are and the direct packaging are dissolvable. This means that they break completely down once submerged in water. Privy potty strips are easily applied over any menacing stall gaps and can be flushed right down the commode when done.

 

    • Eco friendly materials: Made from eco-friendly 100% recyclable materials that contain zero VOC's, Privy potty strips are not only safe to flush but safe for the environment too.

 

    • Superior protection in a small package: Privy potty strips provide protection for any stall. Measuring at 2" wide and roughly 14" long, they can protect you from the largest of gaps in between stall doors. Strips come bearing a deodorizing fresh scent to aid in blocking odor. Once you are finished, easily slip off and flush.
    • Convenient: Grab a pack or two if you know you're heading out with the possibility of a not-so-private bathroom break. Our privacy strip packs can be stashed in your pocket for a quick trip to the restroom, your bag, a purse, or briefcase while you're on the move.

 

 

Privy Options

Privy potty strips come in all natural deodorizing scents made from essential oils. Our strips currently come in 3 different scents -- fresh lemon, citrus, and eucalyptus. We also offer an unscented option. For backers interested in donating there is a reward option to create a customized scent, so that your strips can smell any way that you want them to.

What I have accomplished so far.

I have personally sourced and tested many materials and design styles prior to selecting just the right ones. Our original prototype worked great at providing privacy, but they were not solvable.

Our initial run included Privy potty strips that were thick & bulky, made of a paper that was not dissolvable, and had a backing that was a huge headache.

After months of brainstorming we were able to produce a new strip that is super thin, flushable, and adheres and removes easily. We have eliminated all barriers to our prototype and created a new, more streamlined product using safer materials.

How will the funds be used.

Now that we have tooled a more efficient and solvent strip, this is where we need Indiegogo's support. Having our prototypes production run under our belt and completing such fundamentals like patents and trademarking, we need help funding our final designs first production run, to include: plating, printing, packaging.

 The production process which will take place here in Los Angeles, includes printing our strips using vegetable based inks, deodorizing, and applying a water soluble adhesive to each one, must be completed in a bulk order of 100,000+ sheets of strips. From a business standpoint this is a great way to ensure that we have plenty of product, but from a financial aspect the upfront costs on a new design can get pretty expensive. We have contracted out local vendors for kitting services and assembly. We've selected and designed packaging that is economical and environmentally responsible: bio-degradable earth-friendly containers with potato starch adhesives.

Now Privy potty strips may not be for everyone. Some people don't mind having their hoo-ha out for all the world to see. Others are completely at home squatting in an open field, or peeing behind a bush... and that's okay o_O. But for those times when the last stall is unavailable and you REALLY have to go (you don't want me to go into detail here) and a little privacy would be stellar, these babies are awesome to have at your disposal.


Don't get caught with your pants down

Here is a short list of a few places that Privy potty comes in handy

  • Work - You know those annoying co-workers who ALWAYS have to go when YOU have to go and love hanging out in front of the mirror that's coincidentally in front of your stall? We thought so.
  • Restaurant/Movie theater - There's always an employee in there doing absolutely nothing, except being all over the place.
  • Amusement park - Amusement park food doesn't sit very well when you're being tossed around on roller coasters. Yikes! Since these places are always crowded, don't fall victim to the lurkers who stand directly in front of your stall waiting for you to finish.
  • The Mall - Don't halt your shopping activities, because you know that you wont have any privacy in the mall restroom. Now you can!
  • Any place where the public restrooms have huge gaps in the stall doors - Which is pretty much everywhere.

If you think that Privy potty would be great at providing privacy in public stalls, then please share our project with your friends, family, and nosey co-workers (who've probably caught you peeing a time or two) on Twitter and Facebook.

Thank you for your support

Over the last year, I have been building partnerships with experienced vendors to help mitigate as many risks as possible, and I know that there may still be unexpected occurrences along the way. I strive to be transparent and will inform our backers of potential setbacks if they arise. Although, at this stage the risks are minimal.

We have made an allotment for extra time for the production process. Since this is our second go of it, we are able to avoid the pitfalls we encountered with our 'prototype' batch. Nevertheless, we will always keep our backers informed if things seem to be taking longer than expected.

story:
Meet PACT

Artistic Portland is a project of the Portland Artisans Co-op Team, also known as PACT.  We started at the end of December as a group of strangers who shared an idea, and turned into a tight-knit community that is turning that dream into reality.  Together, we are opening a retail co-operative store where we can sell our handmade goods.

The store is an incredible opportunity for artisans.  Usually, individual craftspeople rely on expensive craft fairs or wholesale/consignment, and spend lots of time and energy marketing their work instead of creating -- and we often feel very alone.  We are keeping our fees as low as possible, to include artisans from every walk of life.  Artistic Portland is opportunity, community, and adventure in one.

We want to capture the creative spirit of Portland, with all its quirks and startling beauty.  With a wide variety of styles and price points, we offer something for all the different people of our city -- all of it high-quality, handcrafted, and locally made.

Why donate?

The Importance of Handmade

The handmade movement is taking off -- and with good reason.  It eliminates the industrial waste and unfair practices so common in modern manufacturing.  Handmade items are often better-made, last longer in the home, and support economy from the bottom up.

Taking the handmade work local just adds to those benefits.  While supporting local economies, it encourages communities and interpersonal connection.  It eliminates shipping expenses (and the extra packaging), and thus avoids the pollution that comes from transporting the goods.

Every item in our shop will be the work of our members -- people you can meet, connect with.  You'll know where all of our supplies come from, and what practices your money is supporting.

Better than Boutique

If you go into a store that sells handmade items, it's likely to be closer to the 'boutique' model -- fine items and very high prices.  While those stores provide a valuable contribution, we find them a bit exclusive.  What for the people whose aesthetic is more natural?  What about the strange, the eclectic, the rough-edged styles?

Portland is home to a variety of vibrant communities, and we didn't want any of them excluded.  So whether you have five dollars to spend or five hundred -- whether you make swarovski-studded jewelry or Dr. Seuss buttons -- we want to welcome all kinds of people into our store.

The Entrepreneur's Dilemma

The artist's dream is to create all the time, but the necessities of selling take energy away from our true work.  We have to manage our own finances, market ourselves, package and ship orders, do our graphic design -- and if we can't do those things, we have to find money to pay for them.  It's a constant struggle for time, and it can get lonely, too.

To sell at an art fair, you need to have a table, lights, displays, perhaps a tent -- you need transportation and time -- and even if you do everything right, the attendance might be poor, or it might rain, and the money you spent on admission is lost.  Having a permanent home for our work removes so much time and uncertainty from the equation -- time that we can spend plying our trade.

The cooperative model is beautiful because it provides not only a location from which to sell, but it provides community.  We can support one another, collaborate on creative projects, and help each other with promotion.  Together, we can accomplish more than any of us can alone.

Where does the money go?

We're lucky to have a lot of resources available in our own community.  Among our members, we have accountants, graphic designers, management professionals, teachers, interior designers, and more -- all using our unique skills to create a successful and well-organized model.

Membership dues will cover our monthly expenses, but we need your help to get started.

With the money we raise here, we'll be able to purchase the basics for opening a store.  We need a register and point-of-sale software to ensure the security of transactions.  We need furniture for displays and backroom storage, and resources to prepare the space for business.

Once the store is set up, we'll need to get the word out.  We know that Portland folk will love us, but they need to hear about us first!

The more funding we receive, the better our infrastructure can be.

Donor Gifts

Check out our list of perks to see the rewards we're offering for donations as small as $5.  All of the items are handmade by PACT members -- the same incredible products we'll have in the store.  There are multiple options for the same donation level, so be sure to check them all out before choosing.

No money to spare?  You can still help!

Cooperatives are all about community -- so come join ours!

If you're a PDX-area artisan and you'd like to join the co-op, you can go to http://www.portlandartisanscoopteam.org to apply.

To keep up with our progress, check out our Facebook page or email artisticportland@gmail.com to sign up for our email newsletter.  (We promise not to spam you!)

Please forward our campaign and video to your friends, family, and social networks.

 

Thank you!

Cooperatives are all about community -- so come join ours!

Please forward our campaign and video to your friends, family, and social networks.
 
Thank you!

story:
The world needs more coloring books that Rock and thanks to you we can now make one. 

We are funded. The coloring book is now at the printers. Thank you for wanting us to succeed. You can buy the coloring book at www.sammyrose.se


I´m a photographer from Sweden and blogger from the world of DosFamily.com

I want to turn my photographs into a coloring book. My hubby Jens , who is an illustrator will be tracing 20-something photographs -turning them into coloring sheets.



I take pictures of pretty much everything. Now I want to turn my pictures into the coolest coloring book ever! 

Everyone who pre orders will receive the coloring book. If the campaign goal is reached we will put the book into production. Ready to hit those Christmas stockings.


How will this story end?
Like this:
-We raise 2200 dollars and make as many copies of this Coloring Book as we can. Ready for delivery on Dec 10th worldwide!
Or like this:
-We only print the Coloring Book in enough copies to cover all the pre- orders.
2? 30? 57? Ready for delivery on Dec 10th worldwide.

From photo to coloring sheet.

Sometimes we add something to the coloring sheet to make it more fun to color. For example dots.

The Coloring Book will contain around 20 coloring sheets. Here are some of the photos that will be turned into coloring sheets.


The world need more coloring books that rock! I find it difficult to find cool coloring books. And even a hardcore Spiderman fan might want to color something else once in a while. Don´t underestimate your kids. They like other stuff then princesses and actionfigures.

I´m being transparent!-telling you how it is!

We love what we do, Jens and I. Photographing and illustrating.
But we ´re not in love with the idea of spending 2200 dollars on something that won´t sell. We´ve been there before. Trust me it´s no fun when your mom is the only one saying "I´ll buy one!"

It is risky investing money in a product. Especially when you are a small business like Jens and I.
We need 2200 dollars to cover the printing costs of 1000 copies.

I would hate having those copies collecting dust in our wardrobe. That´s why we are asking for you support. We want to know:

  • Would you buy this coloring book?
    If so show us by contributing.


  • This Coloring Book is for both kids and adults.
  • Coloring is not only fun it is also soothing for a stressed brain.
  • Leave the dishes for another day and sit down with this Coloring Book and a box of crayons and start coloring together.
  • You are creating a better world by supporting this coloring book. Because lets face it you can´t get into any drama while coloring.

    Trust me!
    I know how to pull this together.
  • My photographs have been published in magazines in Scandinavia , Germany, Italy, USA, Japan, Australia and Indonesia.
  • I´ve also photographed for books published in Sweden. (I have one coming out in March 2014 with my blog-soulmate Isabelle McAllister.

Hard facts about the Coloring Book.

20 coloring sheets. 21x 29 cm
Printed on earth friendly paper. Arctic paper. 100 g
Color Cover on Arctic paper. 170 g
Will ship worldwide.

PS: We are also working on including some of the photographs in the book.

Thinking about contributing?
Go for it!
Here are some of the perks. (You pay them with your credit card. Via Paypal, see Top of the page, to the right)

3 dollars "Pocket change" This is for you who just want to contribute to the project without receiving the damn coloring book
10 dollar "Instagram-love" A Thank You shout out to your instagram account. Don´t forget to tell me your instagram name @jennyfromdosfamily
17 dollar "Lucky number 7" Delivered worldwide ONLY 7 available SOLD OUT
20 dollar "The Coloring Book"  Delivered inside Sweden only.
25 dollar "The Coloring Book" Delivered worldwide
35 dollar The Coloring Book + Personal note Delivered worldwide
150 dollar "Become a coloring sheet" We will trace one photo that you send us. A PDF will be sent to your email. For you to print.
1000 dollar "Become a coloring sheet"- DELUX
Same as above but have me take your picture. Come to my house and let me take your picture. Then we will trace the photo -turning it into a coloring sheet. A PDF will be sent to your email. For you to print.


Other Ways You Can Help

Your support will give us confidence.
If you want to spend your money on something else. Perhaps you can share the project with the world.
You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

By sharing this project you are also helping!
Thank you for that.

-Party on!

A coloring sheet in the making.


PS.For all you lovely Swedes who want to help. Click here to read it in Swedish.För svensk text klicka här!

These are the 24 coloring sheets that will be featured in the book. We will also include some of the photographs that they are based on.
The coloring book is being printed as we speak.

Ready for delivery second week of December.
story_txt:
The world needs more coloring books that Rock and thanks to you we can now make one. We are funded. The coloring book is now at the printers. Thank you for wanting us to succeed. You can buy the coloring book at www.sammyrose.seI´m a photographer from Sweden and blogger from the world of DosFamily.com I want to 
turn my photographs into a coloring book. My hubby Jens , who is an 
illustrator will be tracing 20-something photographs -turning them into coloring sheets.I take pictures of pretty much everything. Now I want to turn my pictures into the coolest coloring book ever! Everyone who pre orders will receive the coloring book. If the campaign 
goal is reached we will put the book into production. Ready to hit those 
Christmas stockings.How will this story end?Like this:-We raise 2200 dollars and make as many copies of this Coloring Book as we can. Ready for delivery on Dec 10th worldwide!Or like this:-We only print the Coloring Book in enough copies to cover all the pre- orders. 2? 30? 57? Ready for delivery on Dec 10th worldwide.From photo to coloring sheet.Sometimes we add something to the coloring sheet to make it more fun to color. For example dots.The Coloring Book will contain around 20 coloring sheets. Here are some of the photos that will be turned into coloring sheets.The world need more coloring books that rock! I
 find it difficult to find cool coloring books. And even a hardcore 
Spiderman fan might want to color something else once in a while. Don´t 
underestimate your kids. They like other stuff then princesses and 
actionfigures. I´m being transparent!-telling you how it is!
We love what we do, Jens and I. Photographing and illustrating. But we ´re not in love with the idea of spending 2200 dollars on something that won´t sell. We´ve been there before. Trust me it´s no fun when your mom is the only one saying "I´ll buy one!"It is risky investing money in a product. Especially when you are a small business like Jens and I. We need 2200 dollars to cover the printing costs of 1000 copies.I would hate having those copies collecting dust in our wardrobe. That´s 
why we are asking for you support. We want to know:Would you buy this coloring book?If so show us by contributing. 

This Coloring Book is for both kids and adults. 

Coloring is not only fun it is also soothing for a stressed brain. 

Leave the dishes for another day and sit down with this Coloring Book and a box of crayons and start coloring together.
You are creating a better world by supporting this coloring book. Because lets face it you can´t get into any drama while coloring. Trust me!I know how to pull this together.

My photographs have been published in magazines in Scandinavia , Germany, Italy, USA, Japan, Australia and Indonesia. 

I´ve also photographed for books published in Sweden. (I have one coming out in March 2014 with my blog-soulmate Isabelle McAllister.

Hard facts about the Coloring Book. 20 coloring sheets. 21x 29 cmPrinted on earth friendly paper. Arctic paper. 100 gColor Cover on Arctic paper. 170 gWill ship worldwide.PS: We are also working on including some of the photographs in the book. Thinking about contributing?Go for it!Here are some of the perks. (You pay them with your credit card. Via Paypal, see Top of the page, to the right)3 dollars "Pocket change" This is for you who just want to contribute to the project without receiving the damn coloring book10 dollar "Instagram-love" A Thank You shout out to your instagram account. Then we will trace the photo -turning it into a coloring sheet. A PDF will be sent to your email. story:
Prize Every Time

Hello, my name is Ryan Collerd and I'm a Philadelphia based freelance photographer.  In August of 2012 I traveled to my home state of New Jersey to document the state fair in Sussex County.  Growing up in this rural corner of the state I went to the fair every summer with friends and family.  When I returned there to work on this project it had been years since I had been to the fair and I was pleasantly surprised at how few things had changed.  But if the fair had remained mostly the same, I myself had changed a great deal, and I spent my time there focusing on all the things I'd failed to notice as a boy. Every day I made hundreds of photographs while stopping occasionally to chat with an old classmate or to make an audio recording.  By the end of the the week I felt I had come away with a successful body of work.

Not long ago I was approached by the good people from Kelly Writers House at the University of Pennsylvania, who asked if I had any work that I would want to exhibit.  I immediately thought of the photos I'd made at the fair, which I had yet to exhibit (though some had appeared on my website).  The prospect of showing this work excited me. However, the cost of printing, framing, and promoting a show can add up, and in this case is prohibitive.  That's where your help would be greatly appreciated.  With this campaign I'm looking to raise $3000 to aid with these costs.  My goal is to hang fifteen 27x18 photographs while a sound installation of my field recordings plays in the Writers House space.  The funds I raise will not only go toward printing, mounting, and framing of the photographs but also toward promotional materials such as postcards and posters.


Your donations will not go unrewarded! Take at look at the perks I'm offering for your help.

The opening of Prize Every Time will be at 6:00pm on 1/29/14 at the Brodsky Gallery in the Kelly Writers House on the campus of the University of Pennsylvania.  Please come out!


Best,


Ryan

story:
Pivot Arts develops new work and presents performances throughout the year culminating in a multi-arts festival. 

Running from June 6-22, Pivot’s inaugural Multi-Arts Festival is a celebration of innovative performance in our community.  This year’s festival reignites the spirit of the Vaudeville Era by performing in unique and historic spaces throughout Uptown and Edgewater.  Top Chicago innovators including: Manual Cinema, Molly Shanahan/Mad Shak, Mucca Pazza, and Theater Oobleck lead a celebration of multi-disciplinary performances in a former Vaudeville Theater, an at-one-time Charlie Chaplin film studio and other exciting spaces.

Check out our wonderous calendar of events!

Your support enables us to pay our artists, market events, and rent equipment that makes the festival possible (including porta-potties!).

You can be a part of making something unique in Chicago by joining Pivot Arts to help us reach our goal. Oh, and you can get some awesome prizes to boot!

Join us at the Festival. Start summer off right with art in your own backyard.  Visit www.pivotarts.org/festival for the complete line-up.

story:
Asia Elects

This year there have been many elections in and around Asia. Many have had expected results, longstanding political leaders have been re-elected in spite of their unpopularity. Others have been more unexpected. Some have had more tragic outcomes with innocent voters being harmed in post-election violence.

This year as part of the Art Licks Weekend in London, the small fragrant country of Duriana is holding its 7th Presidential Elections. Will the incumbent military party win again? Will we get a new more progressive leader? Will a woman be President of Duriana for the first time? Will these elections be free and fair?

All these questions and more will be explored and answered. It is a chance for us to really see democracy in action and appraise its effectiveness and idiosyncrasies. But the election can only happen with some help from you.

The first crowd funded election

The Duriana Electoral Commission invites you, our citizens, to vote in Duriana's 7th Presidential Elections. Help fund this momentous occasion.

  • £5 will buy a volunteer a meal ticket
  • £10 will buy our voters identity cards
  • £20 will source the finest indelible ink known to mankind
  • £50 will buy some clothes for our candidates
  • £100 will buy a state of the art ballot box

All our funders will have the option of being credited as official sponsors of the 7th Duriana Presidential Elections.

Funders who give £50 or more will receive official thank-you letters from The Duriana Electoral Commission.

Your help will fund the basic materials needed and ensure volunteers working behind the scenes on this election get a thank-you meal for their time and effort in bringing this momentous occasion to your doorstep.

Video credits: The Duriana Electoral Commission. Thanks to Cleft Asunder and James Ward (director).

Other Asias has been producing art projects since 2008 working with over 100 artists & writers from across the world. Recent projects have been presented in  Shanaakt festival, Pakistan, Shilpa Academy, Bangladesh, Gwangju, Korea, The Guild Gallery, New York, Aicon Gallery, London. They produce exhibitions, films, zines, commision art works, media, newspapers, critical writing, archives, performances and festivals.They have been nominated for an Al Hamra award for Excellence in the Arts 2013.They co-founded the DIY Cultures day festival.

For more info : www.otherasias.com

http://asiaelects.tumblr.com/

Asia Elects occurs from 3rd October (6pm to 9pm) and 4th - 6th October (11am to 6pm) at The Kobi Nazrul Centre, 30 Hanbury Street, E1 6QR.

story:
(French version follows - La version française se trouve au bas!)

Short Summary

The story

Charles is a new kid in school. He wears long blonde hair, longer than any girl in the classroom, and for that reason he is teased by his classmates. At recess, the boys don't want him in their soccer team because he is too girly, and the girls don't want him in their girl-only club.

It's only at home that he can express his true self. He insists to his parents that he is a she named Charlotte, and dresses with frilly skirts and ribbons. With the help of her friend Chloe, she will find the courage to present as the person she wishes to be.

« Charles is not a boy, » a book about empowering gender-nonconforming children, is the kind of book every school library should own.

The Author

Geneviève Labelle is a Montréal-based art teacher, children's book author, traditional storyteller and fingerweaver. She never identified with the gender she was assigned with at birth.

Now, as a children's book author, Geneviève tries to bring a little light in the life of children that often feel ostracized by society or pushed towards gender conformism through societal pressure.

 

What We Need & What You Get

As the book will be released simultaneously in french and in english, we will need funding to keep the printing costs at the lowest rate possible, so that we can distribute the book at a larger scale.

About the editing, the author deals with a small-size children litterature editing house from Montréal, Qc, called Les Éditions du Fléché, that has already edited one of her previous work. The book will be 32 pages long, and printing a thousand copies in both languages will cost approximatively 2,500$.

Funding will also contribute to pay for the material needed for the project, like cardboards, inks and brushes, as well as promoting material for the book.

The book is scheduled to be out by mid-december.

The Perks

  • Digital downloads of the book, signed copies and promotional material such as posters and t-shirts for small donations!
  • Book donations to specific schools or organisms, original artwork and more!
  • They are a couple of cats appearing through the book. Have your own pet be part of the story!
  • Have some characters bear the name of your choice!
  • And much more!

 

The Impact

The intention behind this book is to explore the problematic of gender-conforming at school. We want to bring the children's attention to the special needs of transgender boys and girls.

As the children's book industry only holds a few titles that frankly discuss those issues, this one will surely have a great place amongst the tools used in elementary school to help explain gender to children.

There are many communities out there that are only waiting for such a book to be published!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this project and get the word out!
    • https://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Charles-is-not-a-boy/510393668971144?fref=ts
  • Mention it to communities or parents interested in those issues!
  • Any positive thought will help!

 

VERSION FRANÇAISE

 POUR LA VERSION FRANÇAISE DE LA VIDÉO : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l7kfUDSr2Gw

Court résumé

L'histoire

Charles est un nouvel élève à l'école. Il porte de très longs cheveux blonds, plus longs que n'importe quelle fille de la classe, et c'est pour cette raison qu'on se moque de lui. Durant la récréation, les garçons ne veulent pas de lui dans leur équipe, et les filles ne veulent pas de lui dans leur club de filles interdit aux garçons. 

Ce n'est qu'une fois à la maison que Charles peut réellement exprimer sa véritable personalité. Il insiste auprès de ses parents pour qu'ils l'appellent Charlotte, et sa garde-robe déborde de robes de toutes sortes.

Avec l'aide de son amie Chloé, elle trouvera le courage de montrer au monde son véritable potentiel.

« Charles n'est pas un garçon » est un livre visant à fournir de l'estime aux enfants ne se conformant pas aux règles de genre. C'est le genre de livre que toute bilbiothèque scolaire devrait posséder!

L'auteure

Geneviève Labelle est une auteure de Montréal, qui enseigne les arts et pratique l'art traditionnel du fléché. Elle ne s'est jamais identifié selon le genre qu'on lui avait assigné à la naissance.

Maintenant, en tant qu'auteure de livres pour enfant, Geneviève Labelle essaie d'apporter un peu de lumière dans la vie d'enfants qui sont souvent ostracisés ou bien poussé vers un conformisme restreignant par la société.

Ce dont on a besoin, ce que vous recevrez

Comme le livre sera publié simultanément en français et en anglais, nous aurons besoin de donations afin de garder les coûts d'impression les plus bas possible, afin que le livre soit accessible au plus grand nombre.

Pour l'édition, l'auteure fait affaire avec Les Éditions du Fléché, une petite maison d'édition de Montréal qui a déjà publié de ses livres précédents. Ce livre-ci fera 32 pages, et d'imprimer un millier de copies dans chaque langue coûtera approximativement 3000$.

Les donations serviront également à couvrir le matériel nécessaire au projet, tel que les papiers bristol, les encres et les pinceaux.

Nous prévoyons la sortie du livre à la mi-décembre.

Les cadeaux

  • Téléchargement digital du livre, copies signées et affiches vous seront envoyées pour les petites donations;
  • Nous ferons des dons de livre aux écoles et organismes de votre choix;
  • Il y a plusieurs chats qui apparaissent dans l'histoire; ayez votre propre animal domestique dans le livre!
  • Renommez certains personnages!
  • Et bien d'autres choses encore!

 

L'impact

L'intention derrière ce livre est d'explorer la problematique de l'identité de genre à l'école. Nous désirons attirer l'attention des enfants sur les besoins des individus transgenres ou ne s'identifiant pas à leur genre attribué à la naissance.

Comme l'industrie du livre pour enfant ne publie qu'un nombre très restreint de titres sur le sujet, ce livre sera assuré d'avoir une bonne place parmi les outils utilisés dans les écoles pour expliquer le genre aux enfants.

Plusieurs communautés n'attendent que de voir un livre de ce genre être publié!

 

D'autres manières d'aider

  • Partagez ce projet sur les réseaux sociaux;
    • https://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Charles-nest-pas-un-gar%C3%A7on/287995771319371?fref=ts
  • Parlez-en aux communautés ou aux parents intéressés par ces problématiques;
  • Envoyez des ondes positives à l'auteure!

story:
Fox Models International

is a model scouting firm that introduces potential models to top model management agencies. They have placed over 150 models at premier agencies such as IMG, Elite, Wilhelmina, Ford Models, Trump, Model Management, One Model Management, Click Model Management, Next Model Management and Marilyn Agency.

They have modeling show cases each year held at Disney World in Florida. It's a two day event-the first is a learning day. The second is the audition in front of 14-15 TOP agencies. This is a HUGE opportunity for anyone-especially for me because I am on a tight time schedule with my age being 22. If I am going to get discovered it has to be soon. What better of a chance do I have getting discovered when I am in front of all TOP agencies in the US.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • $650 participation fee. (I know its a lot but you need to invest money to make money). It's a risk I am willing to take to follow and pursue my dreams.
  • Flights 300-400 round trip.
  • Hotel $135 a night-willing to stay just one or two nights.

The Impact

This could change my life forever. I have the opportunity to be discovered-it's not going to happen here in Syracuse, NY. Out of 100-150 girls 15 will be signed-I could be one of them! I am ready and willing to take that risk to get me to the next step. If it doesn't work out what happens? I have a rewarding experience. I at least can say I tried to pursue my dreams of becoming a model and can move on to the next chapter of my life with some closure.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute its okay! I understand its a tough economy which is why I am using this website to raise money for this event. The next best thing for me would be to spread the word to people that you think can afford to contribute.

 

Again I thank you whether you were able to donate or not. Every dime of this will be put towards this great opportunity. I hope this is a success.

 

My video is from a recent modeling contest I did out of LA! Shows a little more of my modeling career so far.

 


Thank you for helping me follow my dreams,

Erinn
story_txt:
Fox Models International
is a model scouting firm that introduces potential models to top model management agencies. They have placed over 150 models at premier agencies such as IMG, Elite, Wilhelmina, Ford Models, Trump, Model Management, One Model Management, Click Model Management, Next Model Management and Marilyn Agency.
They have modeling show cases each year held at Disney World in Florida. It's a two day event-the first is a learning day. The second is the audition in front of 14-15 TOP agencies. This is a HUGE opportunity for anyone-especially for me because I am on a tight time schedule with my age being 22. If I am going to get discovered it has to be soon. What better of a chance do I have getting discovered when I am in front of all TOP agencies in the US.


What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:

$650 participation fee. (I know its a lot but you need to invest money to make money). It's a risk I am willing to take to follow and pursue my dreams.
Flights 300-400 round trip.
Hotel $135 a night-willing to stay just one or two nights.



The Impact
This could change my life forever. I have the opportunity to be discovered-it's not going to happen here in Syracuse, NY. Out of 100-150 girls 15 will be signed-I could be one of them! I am ready and willing to take that risk to get me to the next step. If it doesn't work out what happens? I have a rewarding experience. I at least can say I tried to pursue my dreams of becoming a model and can move on to the next chapter of my life with some closure.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute its okay! I understand its a tough economy which is why I am using this website to raise money for this event. The next best thing for me would be to spread the word to people that you think can afford to contribute.
 
Again I thank you whether you were able to donate or not. Every dime of this will be put towards this great opportunity. I hope this is a success.

Thank you for helping me follow my dreams,
Erinn

story:
The Idea:

The purpose of this project is threefold: to gain exposure as artists, to be part of something bigger than oneself, and to offer affordable art to the average consumer. 

Most artists love to create but they don't have the skills or desire to market their work. Brick and mortar galleries can't afford to risk their wall space on an unknown artist, and art shows can be expensive and a waste of time. Artists are often left feeling deflated with no real outlet to show their talent and hard work.

One ft2 offers a unique opportunity to emergent artists. Artists from around the world collaborate with One ft2 to create a collection made up of small, representative pieces that serve as a marketing tool for each individual artist. Each piece is an original work of art created on a One ft2 branded panel measuring 12"x12" (one foot square). Because each piece is uniform in size it is easy to group, making an attractive display for any wall. Art collectors, interior designers and home owners can collect pieces from artists all over the world!

Artists are chosen based on their creative abilities demonstrated in their existing body of work. Their completed piece(s) stay in their hands until it is purchased. The artist sends their piece directly to the buyer along with their own marketing material. We believe that once a buyer can hold a piece in his/her hands and see it in his/her own environment he/she is more likely to contact that artist to purchase work that is not part of the One ft2 Collection. 

 

Where we're at:

One ft2 was founded by artist, Lisa Powers. Endless hours of developing the business concept and building the website has made One ft2 what it is today. We have a small number of artists who are currently creating the first pieces for the One ft2 Collection. This Collection shall be ever changing and growing.

We need to attract more artists! We want to offer excellent pieces from artists around the world. (Artist Submission is FREE!) Once we have the artists on board, we then need to take the One ft2 Collection to market - and advertising is pricey!

The idea behind One ft2 World-wide Artist Collaboration is a good one! We need to get the word out so we can bring those who appreciate art to those who create it.

Your money will: 

  • Help artists gain world-wide exposure
  • Introduce art enthusiasts to a diverse group of artists
  • Offer art collectors, interior decorators, home owners, etc. affordable art
  • Pay for the development of our website
  • Pay for our marketing campaigns 

Any funds raised over our fundraising goal will go towards business development and phase 2 - when we ask known artists, celebrities, and professional athletes, to create a piece to be auctioned for their favourite charity. This stage will be exciting! With your help we can get there much sooner!

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please, check out our site: www.oneft2.com 

AND "like" our facebook page: www.facebook.com/oneft2 

Your referrals to anybody remotely interested in art is greatly appreciated!

story:
Short Summary

Hello.  We are Deanna Brown and Lorrie Pierson at Heartfire Creations, LLC.  Our goal is to bridge the gap between 'artsy' people and 'ordinary' people, by creating a whole new place to display artwork:  the fireplace.   We imagine home after home replacing their imitation ceramic logs with original sculpture, crafted from the same fireproof material as the imitation logs; a marriage of art and fire.  We want to commission artwork from established or emerging artists, in which the fire itself becomes an element of the work. Homeowners will find that whatever their particular interest, niche or desire, it can be expressed as a piece of art displayed in the most beautiful possible way: in the fire itself.  The possible range of expression is limitless, from abstract to figurative, erotic or gothically morbid or comic; mythical, modern, narrative or simply illuminating form with the hypnotic flickering light that is fire.  Artists will find new inspiration for creating work and buyers will find artwork that they want to live with in their homes.    

What We Need & What You Get

We have already completed proof of concept prototypes, which we have posted for you in the video.  We are prepared to manufacture on demand, and are in early talks with an international distributor.  Funds raised will  be spent to commission original pieces from working artists and have them manufactured in the fireproof final form.  Artists will be paid full commissions up front and any future sales of a piece will involve full accreditation of the artwork to the artist. They will receive ongoing royalty payments so that if a piece becomes popular it will remain as a continuing source of income to the artist. Artists will be required  to provide an artists' statement and contact links so that if buyers wish to obtain further pieces they can do so.

In order to accommodate a variety of fireplace sizes, we will invest in 3D scanning services, scaling work up and down as needed. 3D scanning also offers limitless possibilities for creating original works, by capturing images from the 'real' world, and rendering them in fireproof 3D.  For example, a classic car buff could have their dream car roaring up out of the flames; the gargoyles of Paris can come to life in your own fire.  An existing original piece can be scanned and recreated in the new medium.   We dream of art and fire, both the joy of the creators in making it and the delight of the owner in having it; every time they light the fire, or even when it is not lit: beautiful, or awful, intense, evocative, gruesome, erotic, comic, heartbreaking, uplifting, disturbing or calming, enduring, ephemeral- artistic, every day.  

This is a project of imagination and we want to crowdsource the dream not just the money to get started.  We will be seeking artists' submissions of possible work to be created and those submissions will be posted online with a Firework forum of backers to evaluate, critique and help select which works will be translated first into the new medium.   All backers will have access to this forum, and we hope to work with some of you in creating actual pieces and traveling abroad to capture images of ancient art to be given new life in a most modern fashion.  When the project moves into the next phase, with artwork submitted, critiqued and chosen, we will have a smashing party to celebrate the achievement with artists, backers, our manufacturers and Heartfire offering mutual congratulations over good food, with music, video, art and fire.  

The Impact

In our headiest moments, we imagine nothing less than a revolution in the fireplace world, in which imitation logs become a relic of the past, or at least just one option among many (more interesting) others.  Artists will have a new outlet for their work, possibly a new source of inspiration.  We also live, however, in the real world, where people struggle simply to heat their homes, cook their food and sanitize water for drinking.    Therefore, upon our company's success, we will donate 10% or more of sales to projects which are seeking to improve peoples lives in more fundamental ways; beginning with Masons on a Mission (www.masonsonamission.org), who works to provide families in Guatemala with enclosed masonry cook stoves to reduce respiratory disease in women and their families created by cooking over open flames.  The masonry stoves require less fuel to generate heat than open flame, resulting in fewer trees cut down for firewood, and less labor for women and children.  Rocket stoves, or thermal mass heaters, can provide heat for a home and a cooking surface with 85% reduction in fuel consumed, and a huge decrease in emissions from combustion, as the volatile gasses which normally go up the chimney become the fuel in the much hotter fire.  From luxury and delight in our country, to improved quality of life around the world, we hope to touch the lives of thousands of human beings before it's over.  

Our product is manufactured in Oregon, by adults working for a decent wage.  Any and all influence we develop as a result of our success will be used to oppose child labor, sweatshops and the exploitation of human beings and the environment for profit.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are an artist and are inspired, please submit a proposal for commission to the project.  If you know an artist, please encourage them to participate.  Artists submissions will be collected in the professional gallery for review/selection by the Fireforum.

If you are not an artist, but are still inspired, please feel free to submit a sketch, a description, or a picture of the art which you imagine would be most amazing in the fire. Submissions will be collected in an Idea Gallery for review and possible selection by the Fireforum.  

Take time to help someone, in whatever way you can imagine.  Our world is in trouble no matter which way you look, but through shared passion, shared vision and shared work, we can make a difference.  Thank you.

story:
Walls of Dreams/Dreams of Walls

“Walls of Dreams/Dreams of Walls” is artist Shira E Landman’s meditation; both on the history of a place and on the nature of historical truth. This is done by taking pictures of the deteriorating bricks at Fort Pike, often in close-up, and rendering them abstract- printed on metal.

Rather than merely documenting what remains of Fort Pike through its walls, Landman meditates or dreams of the walls’ meanings and what can still be felt: The dreams of all those who have encountered Fort Pike — within its walls or outside; For the Native Americans and the African American slaves incarcerated here; The soldiers who also dreamed of returning to families and who wanted to protect the U.S; And now of the park rangers who dream of preserving it — and history.

“Wall of Dreams/Dreams of Walls” will be a permanent metal Installation for the Fort Pike Historic Site - raising continued awareness of the importance of Wetlands, preserving the Fort, and its history.

ABOUT THE ARTIST

Shira Landman was born in Stuttgart, Germany in 1965. She has lived in Italy, France, Israel and the U.S., where she attended The Academy of Art University in San Francisco. After 12 years in New Mexico, Landman moved to New Orleans, Louisiana, where she continues making art and working as a set medic on movie sets. Last summer she worked on the Television series “True Detective” close to Fort Pike; this is where she was introduced to the current Park Rangers. Her environmental art in metal and sculpture focuses on her interests in wilderness, wildlife, landscapes, endangered species, particularly on the themes of life and decay. The environmental Art "Lioness" (2001) is featured in Lucy Lippard's book Undermining.

THE HISTORY OF FORT PIKE

Fort Pike, located 23 miles east of New Orleans, was built in 1819 in the wetlands of Louisiana to protect New Orleans from attack by land or sea. From 1826 when construction was complete to 1890 when it was finally abandoned, Fort Pike served multiple purposes beyond its explicit role of protection. In the end not a single cannon was shot at Fort Pike.

During the Seminole Wars in the 1830s, Fort Pike served as: a staging ground for troops headed to Florida for combat; a prison where Seminole Indians, and the black runaway slaves who formed alliances with them, were held until they could be relocated to Oklahoma, per the so-called Indian Removal Act; and during the Mexican War of the 1840s, soldiers traveling to Texas and Mexico often stayed at Fort Pike.

During the Civil War, after New Orleans fell to the Union Forces who took over Fort Pike, Fort Pike became a refuge for Confederate army deserters, both runaway slaves and freeman from Mississippi, Alabama, and Louisiana; white Southerners with Northern sympathies; Northerners stuck in the south during the outbreak of the war wishing to return home; and for those seeking protection from opportunistic criminals in the northern lake shore during an unstable period in that region’s history. The Union Forces also used Fort Pike as a training ground for The United States Colored Troops, composed of African Americans first recruited to the Union Army during the Civil War, and who, by its end, in 1865, constituted one tenth of its Army.

Abandoned in 1890 and placed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1972, Fort Pike’s once grand citadel and surrounding structures — its hospital, living quarters, carpenter and blacksmiths shop, stores, bakers and boat houses — have disappeared to fires and the surrounding waters.

What’s left is a ghostly shell of what it once was. But Fort Pike’s walls still have their stories.

WHAT THE FUNDS WILL PAY FOR & WHAT YOU WILL GET

The funds will pay for permanent contemporary installation at Fort Pike in the Citadel where You can experience the history and learn about the importance of preserving Wetlands.

“Walls protect, keep things out, and lock things in,” Landman says. But in Walls of Dreams/Dreams of Walls, Landman has created an anti-wall, one that is porous and flexible, capable of allowing the spirit and imagination to soar, like a feather. 

The funds

  • Allow me to produce the metal prints, paint the feathers and the installation the final piece in the citadel. 
  • Allow me to create a marble plate: each person who will get involved by donating money or time will get mentioned on this plate. The plate will be hanging permanently in the Citadel.

Why YOU should support the project Walls of Dreams/Dreams of Walls!

Please give...

1. So that every child can learn history at the Fort Pike State Historic Site  first hand

2. To support undeveloped or restoring Wetlands for birds and wildlife 

3. So visitors can enjoy their experience at Fort Pike and beeing able to walk the grounds

4. To support Walls of Dreams/Dreams of Walls is a contemporary Art Installation to help the Fort and the Wetlands 

5. Because this historic site is Our Backyard .

The Impact

Landman invites you into history, to read this space as a living document. “I didn’t want to create what my eye can see as perfect,” she says. “If you take a little segment out of the big picture, it tells a different story.” To see history, this piece suggests, you have to look at it imaginatively, in fragments. “I see things as a form, a shape, a space, the environment things were built in and what the elements did with it.”

OTHER WAYS TO CONTRIBUTE

Even if you can't contribute financially you can still help:

  1. By getting the word out on Facebook, and email blasts.
  2. By becoming a volunteer and help whitewash the walls and work on the brick floor

There are also Indiegogo share tools to help you out!

4. To support Walls of Dreams/Dreams of Walls is a contemporary Art Installation to help the Fort and the Wetlands 


5. Because this historic site is Our Backyard .
